verses.text: Homilies of St.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 1:2
verses.text: John Chrysostom,  archbishop of constantinople,  on the  second epistle of St.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 1:3
verses.text: paul the apostle  to  Timothy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:1
verses.text: Homily I.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:2
verses.text: Timothy i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:3
verses.text: ,  "Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Jesus Christ, to Timothy, my dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:4
verses.text: What is the reason of his writing this second Epistle to Timothy? He had said, "I hope to come unto thee shortly" ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:5
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:6
verses.text: ), and as this had not taken place, instead of coming to him, he consoles him by a letter, when he was grieving perhaps for his absence, and oppressed by the cares of the government, which he had now taken in hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:7
verses.text: For even great men, when they are placed at the helm, and are charged with the direction of the Church, feel the strangeness of their position, and are overwhelmed, as it were, by the waves of business.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:8
verses.text: This was particularly the case when the Gospel was first preached, when the ground was everywhere unturned, and all was opposition and hostility.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:9
verses.text: There were, besides, heresies commencing from the Jewish teachers, as he has shown in his former Epistle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:10
verses.text: Nor does he only comfort him by letters, he invites him to come to him: "Do thy diligence," he says, "to come shortly unto me," and, "when thou comest, bring with thee the books, but especially the parchments".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:11
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:12
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:14
verses.text: ) And he seems to have written this Epistle when his end was approaching.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:15
verses.text: For he says, "I am now ready to be offered up"; and again, "At my first answer no man stood with me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:16
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:17
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:19
verses.text: ) To set all this right, he both offers consolation from his own trials, and also says,  "Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:20
verses.text: Thus at the very commencement he raises up his mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:21
verses.text: Tell me not, he says, of the dangers here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:22
verses.text: These obtain for us eternal life, where there is no peril, where grief and mourning flee away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:23
verses.text: For He hath not made us Apostles only that we might encounter dangers, but that we might even suffer and die.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:24
verses.text: And as it would not be a consolation to recount to him his own troubles, but rather an increase of his grief, he begins immediately with offering comfort, saying, "According to the promise of life which is in Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:25
verses.text: But if it is a "promise," seek it not here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:26
verses.text: For, "hope that is seen is not hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:27
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:28
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:29
verses.text: )  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:30
verses.text: "To Timothy, my dearly beloved son".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:31
verses.text: Not merely his "son," but, "dearly beloved"; since it is possible for sons not to be beloved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:32
verses.text: Not such, he means, art thou; I call thee not merely a son, but a "dearly beloved son".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:33
verses.text: As he calls the Galatians his children, but at the same time complains of them; "My little children," he says, "of whom I travail in birth again".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:34
verses.text: (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:35
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:36
verses.text: ) And he bears particular testimony to his virtue by calling him "beloved".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:37
verses.text: For where love does not arise from nature, it must arise from the merit of the object.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:38
verses.text: Those who are born of us, are loved not only on account of their virtue, but from the force of nature; but when those who are of the faith are beloved, it is on account of nothing but their merit, for what else can it be? And this especially in the case of Paul, who never acted from partiality.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:39
verses.text: And further, he shows by calling him his "beloved son," that it was not because he was offended with him, or despised him, or condemned him; that he did not come to him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:40
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:41
verses.text: "Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father, and Christ Jesus our Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:42
verses.text: These things which he before prayed for, he again invokes upon him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:43
verses.text: And observe how, at the very beginning, he excuses himself for not having come to him, nor seen him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:44
verses.text: For his words, "Till I come," and, "Hoping to come to thee shortly," had led Timothy to expect his coming soon.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:45
verses.text: For this he excuses himself, but he does not immediately mention the cause of his not coming, lest he should grieve him mightily.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:46
verses.text: For he was detained in prison by the emperor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:47
verses.text: But when at the end of the Epistle he invited him to come to him, then he informed him of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:48
verses.text: He does not at the outset plunge him into sorrow, but encourages the hope that he shall see him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:49
verses.text: "Greatly desiring to see thee," and "Do thy diligence to come unto me shortly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:50
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:51
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:52
verses.text: , and iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:53
verses.text: ) Immediately therefore he raises him up, and proceeds to praise him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:54
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:56
verses.text: "I thank God, whom I serve from my forefathers with pure conscience, that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day; greatly desiring to see thee, being mindful of thy tears, that I might be filled with joy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:57
verses.text: "'I thank God,' he says, 'that I remember thee,' so much do I love thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:58
verses.text: This is a mark of excessive love, when a man glories in his affection from loving so much.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:59
verses.text: "I thank God," he says, "Whom I serve": and how? "With a pure conscience," for he had not violated his conscience.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:60
verses.text: And here he speaks of his blameless life, for he everywhere calls his life his conscience.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:61
verses.text: Or because I never gave up any good that I purposed, for any human cause, not even when I was a persecutor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:62
verses.text: Wherefore he says, "I obtained mercy, because I did it ignorantly in unbelief" ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:63
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:64
verses.text: ); all but saying, "Do not suspect that it was done of wickedness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:65
verses.text: He properly commends his own disposition, that his love may appear sincere.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:66
verses.text: For what he says is in fact, "I am not false, I do not think one thing and profess another".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:67
verses.text: So in the book of Acts we read he was compelled to praise himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:68
verses.text: For when they slandered him as a seditious man and an innovator, he said in his own defense, "Ananias said to me, The God of our fathers hath chosen thee that thou shouldest know His will, and see that Just One, and shouldest hear the voice of His mouth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:69
verses.text: For thou shalt be His witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:70
verses.text: (Acts xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:72
verses.text: ) In the same manner here, that he may not, as if he had been forgetful, have the character of one void of friendship and conscience, he justly praises himself, saying, that "without ceasing I have remembrance of thee," and not simply that, but "in my prayers".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:73
verses.text: That is, it is the business of my prayers, that which I constantly continue to perform.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:74
verses.text: For this he shows by saying, "For this I besought God day and night, desiring to see thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:75
verses.text: Mark his fervent desire, the intensity of his love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:76
verses.text: And again, his humility, how he apologizes to his disciples, and then he shows that it was not on light or vain grounds; and this he had shown us before, but again gives proof of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:77
verses.text: "Being mindful of thy tears".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:78
verses.text: It was natural for Timothy, when parting from him, to mourn and weep, more than a child torn away from the milk and from the breast of its mother.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:79
verses.text: "That I may be filled with joy; greatly desiring to see thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:80
verses.text: I would not willingly have deprived myself of so great a pleasure, though I had been of an unfeeling and brutal nature, for those tears coming to my remembrance would have been enough to soften me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:81
verses.text: But such is not my character.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:82
verses.text: I am one of those who serve God purely; so that many strong motives urged me to come to thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:83
verses.text: So then he wept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:84
verses.text: And he mentions another cause, and that of a consolatory kind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:85
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:86
verses.text: "When I call to remembrance the unfeigned faith that is in thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:87
verses.text: This is another commendation, that Timothy came not of Gentiles, nor of unbelievers, but of a family that served Christ from the first.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:88
verses.text: (Acts xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:90
verses.text: )  "Which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and thy mother Eunice".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:91
verses.text: For Timothy, it says, "was the son of a certain woman which was a Jewess, and believed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:92
verses.text: How a Jewess? how believing? Because she was not of the Gentiles, "but on account of his father, who was a Greek, and of the Jews that were in those quarters, he took and circumcised him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:93
verses.text: Thus, as these mixtures of Jews and Gentiles took place, the Law began gradually to be dissolved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:94
verses.text: And mark in how many ways he shows that he did not despise him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:95
verses.text: "I serve God," he says, "I have a true conscience" for my part, and thou hast thy "tears," and not thy tears only, but for "thy faith," because thou art a laborer for the Truth, because there is no deceit in thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:96
verses.text: As therefore thou showest thyself worthy of love, being so affectionate, so genuine a disciple of Christ; and as I am not one of those who are devoid of affection, but of those who earnestly pursue the Truth; what hindered me from coming to thee?  "And I am persuaded that in thee also".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:97
verses.text: From the beginning, he means, thou hast had this excellency.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:98
verses.text: Thou receivedst from thy forefathers the faith unfeigned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:99
verses.text: For the praises of our ancestors, when we share in them, redound also to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:100
verses.text: Otherwise they avail nothing, but rather condemn us; wherefore he has said, "I am persuaded that in thee also".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:101
verses.text: It is not a conjecture, he means, it is my persuasion; I am fully assured of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:102
verses.text: If therefore from no human motive thou hast embraced it, nothing will be able to shake thy faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:103
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:104
verses.text: "Wherefore I put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of God, which is in thee by the putting on of my hands".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:105
verses.text: You see how greatly dispirited and dejected he considers him to be.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:106
verses.text: He almost says, "Think not that I despise thee, but be assured that I do not condemn thee, nor have I forgotten thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:107
verses.text: Consider, at any rate, thy mother and thy grandmother.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:108
verses.text: It is because I know that thou hast unfeigned faith that I put thee in remembrance".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:109
verses.text: For it requires much zeal to stir up the gift of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:110
verses.text: As fire requires fuel, so grace requires our alacrity, that it may be ever fervent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:111
verses.text: "I put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of God, that is in thee by the putting on of my hands," that is, the grace of the Spirit, which thou hast received, for presiding over the Church, for the working of miracles, and for every service.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:112
verses.text: For this grace it is in our power to kindle or to extinguish; wherefore he elsewhere says, "Quench not the Spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:113
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:114
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:115
verses.text: ) For by sloth and carelessness it is quenched, and by watchfulness and diligence it is kept alive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:116
verses.text: For it is in thee indeed, but do thou render it more vehement, that is, fill it with confidence, with joy and delight.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:117
verses.text: Stand manfully.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:118
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:119
verses.text: "For God hath not given us the spirit of fear, but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:120
verses.text: That is, we did not receive the Spirit, that we should shrink from exertion, but that we may speak with boldness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:121
verses.text: For to many He gives a spirit of fear, as we read in the wars of the Kings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:122
verses.text: "A spirit of fear fell upon them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:123
verses.text: (Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:124
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:125
verses.text: ?) That is, he infused terror into them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:126
verses.text: But to thee He has given, on the contrary, a spirit of power, and of love toward Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:127
verses.text: This, then, is of grace, and yet not merely of grace, but when we have first performed our own parts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:128
verses.text: For the Spirit that maketh us cry, "Abba, Father," inspires us with love both towards Him, and towards our neighbor, that we may love one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:129
verses.text: For love arises from power, and from not fearing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:130
verses.text: For nothing is so apt to dissolve love as fear, and a suspicion of treachery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:131
verses.text: "For God hath not given us the spirit of fear, but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind": he calls a healthy state of the soul a sound mind, or it may mean sobriety of mind, or else a sobering of the mind, that we may be sober-minded, and that if any evil befall us, it may sober us, and cut off superfluities.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:132
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:133
verses.text: Let us then not be distressed at the evils that happen to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:134
verses.text: This is sobriety of mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:135
verses.text: "In the season of temptation," he says, "make not haste".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:136
verses.text: (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:137
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:138
verses.text: ) Many have their several griefs at home, and we share in each other's sorrows, though not in their sources.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:139
verses.text: For one is unhappy on account of his wife, another on account of his child, or his domestic, another of his friend, another of his enemy, another of his neighbor, another from some loss.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:140
verses.text: And various are the causes of sorrow, so that we can find no one free from trouble and unhappiness of some kind or other, but some have greater sorrows and some less.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:141
verses.text: Let us not therefore be impatient, nor think ourselves only to be unhappy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:142
verses.text: For there is no such thing in this mortal life as being exempt from sorrow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:143
verses.text: If not to-day, yet to-morrow; if not to-morrow, yet some later day trouble comes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:144
verses.text: For as one cannot sail, I mean, over a long sea, and not feel disquietude, so it is not possible to pass through this life, without experience of sorrow, yea though you name a rich man; for in that he is rich, he hath many occasions of inordinate desires, yea, though the king himself, since he too is ruled by many, and cannot do all that he would.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:145
verses.text: Many favors he grants contrary to his wishes, and more than all men is obliged to do what he would not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:146
verses.text: How so? Because he has many about him who wish to receive his gifts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:147
verses.text: And just think how great is his chagrin, when he is desirous to effect something, but is unable, either from fear or suspicion, or hindered by enemies or by friends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:148
verses.text: Often when he has succeeded in achieving some end, he loses all the pleasure of it, from many becoming at enmity with him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:149
verses.text: Again, do you think that they are free from grief, who live a life of ease? It is impossible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:150
verses.text: As a man cannot escape death, so neither can he escape sorrow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:151
verses.text: How many troubles must they endure, which we cannot express in words, and which they only can know by experience! How many have prayed a thousand times to die, in the midst of their wealth and luxury! For luxury by no means puts men out of the reach of grief: it is rather the very thing to produce sorrows, diseases, and uneasiness, often when there is no real ground for it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:152
verses.text: For when such is the habit of the soul, it is apt to grieve even without a cause.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:153
verses.text: Physicians say that from a weak state of the stomach arise sorrows without any occasion; and does not the like happen to ourselves, to feel uneasy, without knowing any cause for it? In short, we can find no one who is exempted from sorrow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:154
verses.text: And if he has less occasion for grief than ourselves, yet he thinks otherwise, for he feels his own sorrows, more than those of other men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:155
verses.text: As they who suffer pain in any part of their bodies, think that their sufferings exceed their neighbor's.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:156
verses.text: He that has a disease of the eye, thinks there is nothing so painful, and he that has a disorder in the stomach, considers that the sorest of diseases, and each thinks that the heaviest of sufferings, with which he is himself afflicted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:157
verses.text: So it is with sorrow, each thinks his own present grief the most severe.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:158
verses.text: For of this he judges by his own experience.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:159
verses.text: He that is childless considers nothing so sad as to be without children; he that is poor, and has many children, complains of the extreme evils of a large family.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:160
verses.text: He who has but one, looks upon this as the greatest misery, because that one, being set too much store by, and never corrected, becomes willful, and brings grief upon his father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:161
verses.text: He who has a beautiful wife, thinks nothing so bad as having a beautiful wife, because it is the occasion of jealousy and intrigue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:162
verses.text: He who has an ugly one, thinks nothing worse than having a plain wife, because it is constantly disagreeable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:163
verses.text: The private man thinks nothing more mean, more useless, than his mode of life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:164
verses.text: The soldier declares that nothing is more toilsome, more perilous, than warfare; that it would he better to live on bread and water than endure such hardships.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:165
verses.text: He that is in power thinks there can be no greater burden than to attend to the necessities of others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:166
verses.text: He that is subject to that power, thinks nothing more servile than living at the beck of others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:167
verses.text: The married man considers nothing worse than a wife, and the cares of marriage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:168
verses.text: The unmarried declares there is nothing so wretched as being unmarried, and wanting the repose of a home.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:169
verses.text: The merchant thinks the husbandman happy in his security.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:170
verses.text: The husbandman thinks the merchant so in his wealth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:171
verses.text: In short, all mankind are somehow hard to please, and discontented and impatient.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:172
verses.text: When condemning the whole race, he saith, "Man is a thing of nought" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:173
verses.text: cxliv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:174
verses.text: ), implying that the whole kind is a wretched unhappy creature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:175
verses.text: How many long for old age! How many think youth a happy time! Thus each different period has its unhappiness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:176
verses.text: When we find ourselves censured on account of our youth, we say, why are we not old? and when our heads are hoary, we ask whither has our youth flown? Numberless, in short, are the occasions of sorrow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:177
verses.text: There is one path only by which this unevenness can be escaped.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:178
verses.text: It is the path of virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:179
verses.text: Yet that too has its sorrows, only they are sorrows not unprofitable, but productive of gain and advantage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:180
verses.text: For if any one has sinned, he washes away his sin by the compunction that comes of his sorrow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:181
verses.text: Or, if he has grieved in sympathizing with a fallen brother, this is not without its recompense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:182
verses.text: For sympathy with those that are in misery gives us great confidence towards God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:183
verses.text: Hear therefore what philosophy is taught by the example of Job in holy Scripture! Hear also what Paul saith: "Weep with them that weep"; and again, "Condescend to men of low estate".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:184
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:185
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:187
verses.text: ) For, by the communication of sorrow, the extreme burden of it is lightened.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:188
verses.text: For as in the case of a heavy load, he that bears part of the weight relieves him who was bearing it alone, so it is in all other things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:189
verses.text: But now, when any one of our relatives dies, there are many who sit by and console us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:190
verses.text: Nay, we often raise up even an ass that has fallen; but when the souls of our brethren are falling, we overlook them and pass by, as if they were of less value than an ass.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:191
verses.text: And if we see any one entering into a tavern indecently; nay, if we see him drunk, or guilty of any other unseemly action, we do not restrain him, we rather join him in it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:192
verses.text: Whence Paul has said: "They not only do these things, but have pleasure in them that do them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:193
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:194
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:195
verses.text: ) The greater part even form associations for the purposes of drunkenness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:196
verses.text: But do thou, O man, form associations to restrain the madness of inebriety.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:197
verses.text: Such friendly doings are beneficial to those who are in bonds or in affliction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:198
verses.text: Something of this kind Paul enjoined to the Corinthians, alluding to which he says, "That there be no gatherings when I come".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:199
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:200
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:201
verses.text: ) But now everything is done with a view to luxury, reveling, and pleasure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:202
verses.text: We have a common seat, a common table, we have wine in common, and common expenses, but we have no community of alms.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:203
verses.text: Such were the friendly doings in the time of the Apostles; they brought all their goods into the common stock.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:204
verses.text: Now I do not require you to bestow all, but some part.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:205
verses.text: "Let each lay by him in store on the first day of the week, as God has prospered him," and lay it down as a tribute for the seven days.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:206
verses.text: In this way give alms, whether more or less.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:207
verses.text: "For thou shalt not appear before the Lord empty".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:208
verses.text: (Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:209
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:210
verses.text: ) This was said to the Jews, how much more then to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:211
verses.text: For this cause the poor stand before the doors, that no one may enter empty, but each may do alms at his entrance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:212
verses.text: Thou enterest to implore mercy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:213
verses.text: First show mercy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:214
verses.text: He that comes later owes the more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:215
verses.text: For when we have been first, he that is second pays down more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:216
verses.text: Make God thy debtor, and then offer thy prayers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:217
verses.text: Lend to Him, and then ask a return, and thou shalt receive it with usury.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:218
verses.text: God wills this, and does not retract.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:219
verses.text: If thou ask with alms, He holds himself obliged.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:220
verses.text: If thou ask with alms, thou lendest and receivest interest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:221
verses.text: Yes, I beseech you! It is not for stretching out thy hands thou shalt be heard! stretch forth thy hands, not to heaven, but to the poor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:222
verses.text: If thou stretch forth thy hand to the hands of the poor, thou hast reached the very summit of heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:223
verses.text: For He who sits there receives thine alms.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:224
verses.text: But if thou liftest them up without a gift, thou gainest nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:225
verses.text: If the king, arrayed in purple, should come to thee and ask an alms, wouldest thou not readily give all that thou hast? But now when thou art entreated through the poor, not by an earthly but a heavenly King, dost thou stand regardless, and defer thy gift? What punishment then dost thou not deserve? For the being heard depends not upon the lifting up of thy hands, nor on the multitude of thy words, but upon thy works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:226
verses.text: For hear the prophet, "When ye" spread "forth your hands, I will hide mine eyes from you: yea, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:227
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:228
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:229
verses.text: ) For he ought to be silent, who needs mercy, and not even to look up to heaven; he that hath confidence may say much.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:230
verses.text: But what says the Scripture, "Judge for the fatherless, plead for the widow, learn to do good".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:231
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:232
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:233
verses.text: ) In this way we shall be heard, though we lift not up our hands, nor utter a word, nor make request.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 2:234
verses.text: In these things then let us be zealous, that we may obtain the promised blessings, through the grace and lovingkindness, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:1
verses.text: Homily II.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:2
verses.text: Timothy i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:3
verses.text: "Be not thou therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me His prisoner: but be thou partaker of the afflictions of the Gospel according to the power of God; Who hath saved us, and called us with an holy calling, not according to our works, but according to His own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began; but is now made manifest by the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:4
verses.text: There is nothing worse than that man should measure and judge of divine things by human reasonings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:5
verses.text: For thus he will fall from that rock a vast distance, and be deprived of the light.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:6
verses.text: For if he who wishes with human eyes to apprehend the rays of the sun will not only not apprehend them, but, besides this failure, will sustain great injury; so, but in a higher degree, is he in a way to suffer this, and abusing the gift of God, who would by human reasonings gaze intently on that Light.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:7
verses.text: Observe accordingly how Marcion, and Manes, and Valentinus, and others who introduced their heresies and pernicious doctrines into the Church of God, measuring divine things by human reasonings, became ashamed of the Divine economy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:8
verses.text: Yet it was not a subject for shame, but rather for glorying; I speak of the Cross of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:9
verses.text: For there is not so great a sign of the love of God for mankind, not heaven, nor sea, nor earth, nor the creation of all things out of nothing, nor all else beside, as the Cross.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:10
verses.text: Hence it is the boast of Paul, "God forbid that I should glory, save in the Cross of our Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:11
verses.text: (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:12
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:13
verses.text: ) But natural men, and those who attribute to God no more than to human beings, stumble, and become ashamed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:14
verses.text: Wherefore Paul from the first exhorts his disciple, and through him all others, in these words: "Be not thou ashamed of the testimony of our Lord," that is, "Be not ashamed, that thou preachest One that was crucified, but rather glory in it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:15
verses.text: For in themselves death and imprisonment and chains are matters of shame and reproach.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:16
verses.text: But when the cause is added before us, and the mystery viewed aright, they will appear full of dignity, and matter for boasting.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:17
verses.text: For it was that death which saved the world, when it was perishing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:18
verses.text: That death connected earth with heaven, that death destroyed the power of the devil, and made men angels, and sons of God: that death raised our nature to the kingly throne.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:19
verses.text: Those chains were the conversion of many.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:20
verses.text: "Be not" therefore "ashamed," he says, "of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me His prisoner: but be thou partaker of the afflictions of the Gospel"; that is, though thou shouldest suffer the same things, be not thou ashamed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:21
verses.text: For that this is implied appears from what he said above; "God hath given us a spirit of power, and of love, and of a sound mind"; and by what follows, "Be thou partaker of the sufferings of the Gospel": not merely be not ashamed of them, but be not ashamed even to experience them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:22
verses.text: And he does not say, "Do not fear," but, the more to encourage him, "be not ashamed," as if there were no further danger, if he could overcome the shame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:23
verses.text: For shame is only then oppressive, when one is overcome by it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:24
verses.text: Be not therefore ashamed, if I, who raised the dead, who wrought miracles, who traversed the world, am now a prisoner.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:25
verses.text: For I am imprisoned, not as a malefactor, but for the sake of Him who was crucified.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:26
verses.text: If my Lord was not ashamed of the Cross, neither am I of chains.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:27
verses.text: And with great propriety, when he exhorts him not to be ashamed, he reminds him of the Cross.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:28
verses.text: If thou art not ashamed of the Cross, he means, neither be thou of chains; if our Lord and Master endured the Cross, much more should we chains.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:29
verses.text: For he who is ashamed of what He endured, is ashamed of Him that was crucified.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:30
verses.text: Now it is not on my own account that I bear these chains; therefore do not give way to human feelings, but bear thy part in these sufferings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:31
verses.text: "Be partaker of the afflictions of the Gospel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:32
verses.text: He says not this, as if the Gospel could suffer injury, but to excite his disciple to suffer for it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:33
verses.text: "According to the power of God; Who hath saved us, and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but according to His own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:34
verses.text: More especially because it was a hard thing to say, "Be partakers of afflictions," he again consoles him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:35
verses.text: Reckon that thou sustainest these things, not by thine own power, but by the power of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:36
verses.text: For it is thy part to choose and to be zealous, but God's to alleviate sufferings and bid them cease.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:37
verses.text: He then shows him the proofs of His power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:38
verses.text: Consider how thou wast saved, how thou wast called.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:39
verses.text: As he elsewhere says, "According to His power that worketh in us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:40
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:41
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:42
verses.text: ) So much was it a greater exercise of power to persuade the world to believe, than to make the Heavens.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:43
verses.text: But how was he "called with a holy calling"? This means, He made them saints, who were sinners and enemies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:44
verses.text: "And this not of ourselves, it was the gift of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:45
verses.text: If then He is mighty in calling us, and good, in that He hath done it of grace and not of debt, we ought not to fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:46
verses.text: For He Who, when we should have perished, saved us, though enemies, by grace, will He not much more cooperate with us, when He sees us working? "Not according to our own works," he says, "but according to his own purpose and grace," that is, no one compelling, no one counseling Him, but of His own purpose, from the impulse of His own goodness, He saved us; for this is the meaning of "according to His own purpose".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:47
verses.text: "Which was given us before the world began".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:48
verses.text: That is, it was determined without beginning that these things should be done in Christ Jesus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:49
verses.text: This is no light consideration, that from the first He willed it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:50
verses.text: It was not an after-thought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:51
verses.text: How then is not the Son eternal? for He also willed it from the beginning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:52
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:53
verses.text: "But is now made manifest by the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ, Who hath abolished death, and hath brought life and immortality to light by the Gospel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:54
verses.text: Thou seest the power, thou seest the gift bestowed not by works, but through the Gospel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:55
verses.text: These are objects of hope: for both were wrought in His Body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:56
verses.text: And how will they be wrought in ours? "By the Gospel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:57
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:58
verses.text: "Whereunto I am appointed a preacher and an Apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:59
verses.text: Why does he so constantly repeat this, and call himself a teacher of the Gentiles? Because he wishes to persuade them that they also ought to draw close to the Gentiles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:60
verses.text: Be not therefore dismayed at my sufferings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:61
verses.text: The sinews of death are unstrung.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:62
verses.text: It is not as a malefactor that I suffer, but because I am "a teacher of the Gentiles".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:63
verses.text: At the same time he makes his discourse worthy of credit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:64
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:65
verses.text: "For the which cause I also suffer these things, nevertheless I am not ashamed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:66
verses.text: For I know Whom I have believed, and am persuaded that He is able to keep that which I have committed unto Him against that day".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:67
verses.text: "I am not ashamed," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:68
verses.text: For are chains, are sufferings, a matter for shame? Be not then ashamed! Thou seest how he illustrates his teaching by his works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:69
verses.text: "These things," he says, "I suffer": I am cast into prison, I am banished; "For I know Whom I have believed, and am persuaded that He is able to keep that which I have committed to Him against That Day".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:70
verses.text: What is "that which is committed"? The faith, the preaching of the Gospel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:71
verses.text: He, who committed this to him, he says, will preserve it unimpaired.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:72
verses.text: I suffer everything, that I may not be despoiled of this treasure, and I am not ashamed at these things, so long as it is preserved uninjured.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:73
verses.text: Or he calls the Faithful the charge which God committed to him, or which he committed to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:74
verses.text: For he says, "Now I commit you to the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:75
verses.text: (Acts xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:76
verses.text: ) That is, these things will not be unprofitable to me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:77
verses.text: And in Timothy is seen the fruit of the charge thus "committed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:78
verses.text: You see that he is insensible to sufferings, from the hope that he entertains of his disciples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:79
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:80
verses.text: Such ought a Teacher to be, so to regard his disciples, to think them everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:81
verses.text: "Now we live," he says, "if ye stand fast in the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:82
verses.text: And again, "What is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? are not even ye in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ?" ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:83
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:84
verses.text: , and ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:85
verses.text: ) You see his anxiety in this matter, his regard for the good of his disciples, not less than for his own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:86
verses.text: For teachers ought to surpass natural parents, to be more zealous than they.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:87
verses.text: And it becomes their children to be kindly affectioned towards them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:88
verses.text: For he says, "Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls as they that must give account".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:89
verses.text: (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:90
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:91
verses.text: ) For say, is he subject to so dangerous a responsibility, and art thou not willing to obey him, and that too, for thy own benefit? For though his own state should be good, yet as long as thou art in a bad condition his anxiety continues, he has a double account to render.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:92
verses.text: And consider what it is to be responsible and anxious for each of those who are under his rule.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:93
verses.text: What honor wouldest thou have reckoned equal, what service, in requital of such dangers? Thou canst not offer an equivalent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:94
verses.text: For thou hast not yet devoted thy soul for him, but he lays down his life for thee, and if he lays it not down here, when the occasion requires it, he loses it There.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:95
verses.text: But thou art not willing to submit even in words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:96
verses.text: This is the prime cause of all these evils, that the authority of rulers is neglected, that there is no reverence, no fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:97
verses.text: He says, "Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:98
verses.text: But now all is turned upside down and confounded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:99
verses.text: And this I say not for the sake of the rulers; (for what benefit will they have of the honor they receive from us, except so far as we are rendered obedient;) but I say it for your advantage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:100
verses.text: For with respect to the future, they will not be benefited by the honor done them, but receive the greater condemnation, neither will they be injured as to the future by ill treatment, but will have the more excuse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:101
verses.text: But all this I desire to be done for your own sakes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:102
verses.text: For when rulers are honored by their people, this too is reckoned against them; as in the case of Eli it is said, "Did I not choose him out of his father's house?" ( Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:103
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:104
verses.text: ) But when they are insulted, as in the instance of Samuel, God said, "They have not rejected thee, but they have rejected Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:105
verses.text: ( Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:106
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:107
verses.text: ) Therefore insult is their gain, honor their burden.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:108
verses.text: What I say, therefore, is for your sakes, not for theirs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:109
verses.text: He that honors the Priest, will honor God also; and he who has learnt to despise the Priest, will in process of time insult God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:110
verses.text: "He that receiveth you," He saith, "receiveth Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:111
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:112
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:113
verses.text: ) "Hold my priests in honor" (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:114
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:115
verses.text: ?), He says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:116
verses.text: The Jews learned to despise God, because they despised Moses, and would have stoned him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:117
verses.text: For when a man is piously disposed towards the Priest, he is much more so towards God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:118
verses.text: And even if the Priest be wicked, God seeing that thou respectest him, though unworthy of honor, through reverence to Him, will Himself reward thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:119
verses.text: For if "he that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet's reward" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:120
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:121
verses.text: ); then he who honoreth and submitteth and giveth way to the Priest shall certainly be rewarded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:122
verses.text: For if in the case of hospitality, when thou knowest not the guest, thou receivest so high a recompense, much more wilt thou be requited, if thou obeyest him whom He requires thee to obey.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:123
verses.text: "The Scribes and Pharisees," He says, "sit in Moses' seat; all therefore, whatsoever they bid you observe, that observe and do, but do not ye after their works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:124
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:125
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:127
verses.text: ) Knowest thou not what the Priest is? He is an Angel of the Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:128
verses.text: Are they his own words that he speaks? If thou despisest him, thou despisest not him, but God that ordained him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:129
verses.text: But how does it appear, thou askest, that he is ordained of God? Nay, if thou suppose it otherwise, thy hope is rendered vain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:130
verses.text: For if God worketh nothing through his means, thou neither hast any Laver, nor art partaker of the Mysteries, nor of the benefit of Blessings; thou art therefore not a Christian.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:131
verses.text: What then, you say, does God ordain all, even the unworthy? God indeed doth not ordain all, but He worketh through all, though they be themselves unworthy, that the people may be saved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:132
verses.text: For if He spoke, for the sake of the people, by an ass, and by Balaam, a most wicked man, much more will He speak by the mouth of the Priest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:133
verses.text: What indeed will not God do or say for our salvation? By whom doth He not act? For if He wrought through Judas and those other that "prophesied," to whom He will say, "I never knew you; depart from Me, ye workers of iniquity" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:134
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:136
verses.text: ); and if others "cast out devils" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:137
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:138
verses.text: ); will He not much more work through the Priests? Since if we were to make inquisition into the lives of our rulers, we should then become the ordainers of our own teachers, and all would be confusion; the feet would be uppermost, the head below.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:139
verses.text: Hear Paul saying, "But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged of you, or of man's judgment".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:140
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:141
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:142
verses.text: ) And again, "Why dost thou judge thy brother?" (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:143
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:144
verses.text: ) For if we may not judge our brother, much less our teacher.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:145
verses.text: If God commands this indeed, thou doest well, and sinnest if thou do it not; but if the contrary, dare not do it, nor attempt to go beyond the lines that are marked out.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:146
verses.text: After Aaron had made the golden calf, Corah, Dathan, and Abiram raised an insurrection against him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:147
verses.text: And did they not perish? Let each attend to his own department.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:148
verses.text: For if he teach perverted doctrine, though he be an Angel, obey him not; but if he teach the truth, take heed not to his life, but to his words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:149
verses.text: Thou hast Paul to instruct thee in what is right both by words and works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:150
verses.text: But thou sayest, "He gives not to the poor, he does not govern well".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:151
verses.text: Whence knowest thou this? Blame not, before thou art informed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:152
verses.text: Be afraid of the great account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:153
verses.text: Many judgments are formed upon mere opinion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:154
verses.text: Imitate thy Lord, who said, "I will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it, and if not, I will know".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:155
verses.text: (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:156
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:157
verses.text: ) But if thou hast enquired, and informed thyself, and seen; yet await the Judge, and usurp not the office of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:158
verses.text: To Him it belongs, and not to thee, to make this inquisition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:159
verses.text: Thou art an inferior servant, not a master.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:160
verses.text: Thou art a sheep, be not curious concerning the shepherd, lest thou have to give account of thy accusations against him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:161
verses.text: But you say, How does he teach me that which he does not practice himself? It is not he that speaks to thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:162
verses.text: If it be he whom thou obeyest, thou hast no reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:163
verses.text: It is Christ that thus admonishes thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:164
verses.text: And what do I say? Thou oughtest not to obey even Paul, if he speaks of himself, or anything human, but the Apostle, that has Christ speaking in him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:165
verses.text: Let not us judge one another's conduct, but each his own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:166
verses.text: Examine thine own life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:167
verses.text: But thou sayest, "He ought to be better than I".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:168
verses.text: Wherefore? "Because he is a Priest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:169
verses.text: And is he not superior to thee in his labors, his dangers, his anxious conflicts and troubles? But if he is not better, oughtest thou therefore to destroy thyself? These are the words of arrogance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:170
verses.text: For how is he not better than thyself? He steals, thou sayest, and commits sacrilege! How knowest thou this? Why dost thou cast thyself down a precipice? If thou shouldest hear it said that such an one hath a purple robe, though thou knewest it to be true, and couldest convict him, thou declinest to do it, and pretendest ignorance, not being willing to run into unnecessary danger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:171
verses.text: But in this case thou art so far from being backward, that even without cause thou exposest thyself to the danger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:172
verses.text: Nor think thou art not responsible for these words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:173
verses.text: Hear what Christ says, "Every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:174
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:175
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:176
verses.text: ) And dost thou think thyself better than another, and dost thou not groan, and beat thy breast, and bow down thy head, and imitate the Publican?  And then thou destroyest thyself, though thou be better.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:177
verses.text: Be silent, that thou cease not to be better.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:178
verses.text: If thou speak of it, thou hast done away the merit; if thou thinkest it, I do not say so; if thou dost not think it, thou hast added much.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:179
verses.text: For if a notorious sinner, when he confessed, "went home justified," he who is a sinner in a less degree, and is conscious of it, how will he not be rewarded? Examine thy own life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:180
verses.text: Thou dost not steal; but thou art rapacious, and overbearing, and guilty of many other such things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:181
verses.text: I say not this to defend theft; God forbid! deeply lament if there is any one really guilty of it, but I do not believe it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:182
verses.text: How great an evil is sacrilege, it is impossible to say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:183
verses.text: But I spare you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:184
verses.text: For I would not that our virtue should be rendered vain by accusing others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:185
verses.text: What was worse than the Publican? For it is true that he was a publican, and guilty of many offenses, yet because the Pharisee only said, "I am not as this publican," he destroyed all his merit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:186
verses.text: I am not, thou sayest, like this sacrilegious Priest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:187
verses.text: And dost not thou make all in vain?  This I am compelled to say, and to enlarge upon in my discourse, not so much because I am concerned for them, but because I fear for you, lest you should render your virtue vain by this boasting of yourselves, and condemnation of others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:188
verses.text: For hear the exhortation of Paul, "Let every one prove his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:189
verses.text: (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:190
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:191
verses.text: )  If you had a wound, tell me, and should go to a physician, would you stay him from salving and dressing your own wound, and be curious to enquire whether the physician had a wound, or not? and if he had, would you mind it? Or because he had it, would you forbear dressing your own, and say, A physician ought to be in sound health, and since he is not so, I shall let my wound go uncured? For will it be any palliation for him that is under rule, that his Priest is wicked? By no means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:192
verses.text: He will suffer the destined punishment, and you too will meet with that which is your due.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:193
verses.text: For the Teacher now only fills a place.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:194
verses.text: For "it is written, They shall all be taught of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:195
verses.text: (John vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:196
verses.text: ; Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:197
verses.text: liv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:198
verses.text: ) "Neither shall they say, Know the Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:199
verses.text: For all shall know Me from the least to the greatest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:200
verses.text: (Jer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:201
verses.text: xxxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:202
verses.text: ) Why then, you will say, does he preside? Why is he set over us? I beseech you, let us not speak ill of our teachers, nor call them to so strict an account, lest we bring evil upon ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:203
verses.text: Let us examine ourselves, and we shall not speak ill of others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:204
verses.text: Let us reverence that day, on which he enlightened us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:205
verses.text: He who has a father, whatever faults he has, conceals them all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:206
verses.text: For it is said, "Glory not in the dishonor of thy father; for thy father's dishonor is no glory unto thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:207
verses.text: And if his understanding fail, have patience with him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:208
verses.text: (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:209
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:211
verses.text: ) And if this be said of our natural fathers, much more of our spiritual fathers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:212
verses.text: Reverence him, in that he every day ministers to thee, causes the Scriptures to be read, sets the house in order for thee, watches for thee, prays for thee, stands imploring God on thy behalf, offers supplications for thee, for thee is all his worship.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:213
verses.text: Reverence all this, think of this, and approach him with pious respect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:214
verses.text: Say not, he is wicked.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:215
verses.text: What of that? He that is not wicked, doth he of himself bestow upon thee these great benefits? By no means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:216
verses.text: Everything worketh according to thy faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:217
verses.text: Not even the righteous man can benefit thee, if thou art unfaithful, nor the unrighteous harm thee, if thou art faithful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:218
verses.text: God, when He would save His people, wrought for the ark by Oxen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:219
verses.text: Is it the good life or the virtue of the Priest that confers so much on thee? The gifts which God bestows are not such as to be effects of the virtue of the Priest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:220
verses.text: All is of grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:221
verses.text: His part is but to open his mouth, while God worketh all: the Priest only performs a symbol.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:222
verses.text: Consider how wide was the distance between John and Jesus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:223
verses.text: Hear John saying, "I have need to be baptized of Thee" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:224
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:225
verses.text: ), and, "Whose shoe's latchet I am not worthy to unloose".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:226
verses.text: (John i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:227
verses.text: ) Yet notwithstanding this difference, the Spirit descended.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:228
verses.text: Which John had not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:229
verses.text: For "of His fullness," it is said, "we all have received".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:230
verses.text: (John i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:231
verses.text: ) Yet nevertheless, It descended not till He was baptized.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:232
verses.text: But neither was it John who caused It to descend.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:233
verses.text: Why then is this done? That thou mayest learn that the Priest performs a symbol.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:234
verses.text: No man differs so widely from another man, as John from Jesus, and yet with him the Spirit descended, that we may learn, that it is God who worketh all, that all is God's doing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:235
verses.text: I am about to say what may appear strange, but be not astonished nor startled at it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:236
verses.text: The Offering is the same, whether a common man, or Paul or Peter offer it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:237
verses.text: It is the same which Christ gave to His disciples, and which the Priests now minister.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:238
verses.text: This is nowise inferior to that, because it is not men that sanctify even this, but the Same who sanctified the one sanctifies the other also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:239
verses.text: For as the words which God spake are the same which the Priest now utters, so is the Offering the same, and the Baptism, that which He gave.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:240
verses.text: Thus the whole is of faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:241
verses.text: The Spirit immediately fell upon Cornelius, because he had previously fulfilled his part, and contributed his faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:242
verses.text: And this is His Body, as well as that.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:243
verses.text: And he who thinks the one inferior to the other, knows not that Christ even now is present, even now operates.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:244
verses.text: Knowing therefore these things, which we have not said without reason, but that we may conform your minds in what is right, and render you more secure for the future, keep carefully in mind what has been spoken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:245
verses.text: For if we are always hearers, and never doers, we shall reap no advantage from what is said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:246
verses.text: Let us therefore attend diligently to the things spoken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:247
verses.text: Let us imprint them upon our minds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 3:248
verses.text: Let us have them ever engraved upon our consciences, and let us continually ascribe glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:1
verses.text: Homily III.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:2
verses.text: Timothy i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:3
verses.text: "Hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard of me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:4
verses.text: That good thing which was committed unto thee keep by the Holy Ghost Which dwelleth in us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:5
verses.text: This thou knowest, that all they which are in Asia be turned away from me; of whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:6
verses.text: The Lord give mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus; for he oft refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain: but, when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently, and found me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:7
verses.text: The Lord grant unto him that he may find mercy of the Lord in that day: and in how many things he ministered unto me at Ephesus, thou knowest very well".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:8
verses.text: Not by letters alone did Paul instruct his disciple in his duty, but before by words also which he shows, both in many other passages, as where he says, "whether by word or our Epistle" ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:9
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:10
verses.text: ), and especially here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:11
verses.text: Let us not therefore suppose that anything relating to doctrine was spoken imperfectly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:12
verses.text: For many things he delivered to him without writing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:13
verses.text: Of these therefore he reminds him, when he says, "Hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard of me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:14
verses.text: After the manner of artists, I have impressed on thee the image of virtue, fixing in thy soul a sort of rule, and model, and outline of all things pleasing to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:15
verses.text: These things then hold fast, and whether thou art meditating any matter of faith or love, or of a sound mind, form from hence your ideas of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:16
verses.text: It will not be necessary to have recourse to others for examples, when all has been deposited within thyself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:17
verses.text: "That good thing which was committed unto thee keep,"how?"by the Holy Ghost which dwelleth in us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:18
verses.text: For it is not in the power of a human soul, when instructed with things so great, to be sufficient for the keeping of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:19
verses.text: And why? Because there are many robbers, and thick darkness, and the devil still at hand to plot against us; and we know not what is the hour, what the occasion for him to set upon us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:20
verses.text: How then, he means, shall we be sufficient for the keeping of them? "By the Holy Ghost"; that is if we have the Spirit with us, if we do not expel grace, He will stand by us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:21
verses.text: For, "Except the Lord build the house, they labor in vain that build it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:22
verses.text: Except the Lord keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:23
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:24
verses.text: cxxvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:25
verses.text: ) This is our wall, this our castle, this our refuge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:26
verses.text: If therefore It dwelleth in us, and is Itself our guard, what need of the commandment? That we may hold It fast, may keep It, and not banish It by our evil deeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:27
verses.text: Then he describes his trials and temptations, not to depress his disciple, but to elevate him, that if he should ever fall into the same, he may not think it strange, when he looks back and remembers what things happened to his Teacher.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:28
verses.text: What then says he? Since it was probable that Timothy might be apprehended, and be deserted, and be relieved by no friendly attention, or influence, or assistance, but be abandoned even by his friends and the faithful themselves, hear what he says, "This thou knowest, that all they which are in Asia be turned away from me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:29
verses.text: It seems that there were then in Rome many persons from the regions of Asia.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:30
verses.text: "But no one stood by me," he says, no one acknowledged me, all were alienated.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:31
verses.text: And observe the philosophy of his soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:32
verses.text: He only mentions their conduct, he does not curse them, but he praises him that showed kindness to him, and invokes a thousand blessings upon him, without any curse on them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:33
verses.text: "Of whom is Phygellus and Hermogenes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:34
verses.text: The Lord give mercy to the house of Onesiphorus, for he oft refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:35
verses.text: But, when he was in Rome, he sought me out diligently and found me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:36
verses.text: Observe how he everywhere speaks of the shame, and not of the danger, lest Timothy should be alarmed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:37
verses.text: And yet it was a thing that was full of peril.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:38
verses.text: For he gave offense to Nero by making friends with one of his prisoners.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:39
verses.text: But when he was in Rome, he says, he not only did not shun intercourse with me, but "sought me out very diligently, and found me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:40
verses.text: "The Lord grant unto him that he may find mercy of the Lord in that day: and in how many things he ministered unto me at Ephesus, thou knowest very well".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:41
verses.text: Such ought the faithful to be.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:42
verses.text: Neither fear, nor threats, nor disgrace, should deter them from assisting one another, standing by them and succoring them as in war.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:43
verses.text: For they do not so much benefit those who are in danger, as themselves, by the service they render to them, making themselves partakers of the crowns due to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:44
verses.text: For example, is any one of those who are devoted to God visited with affliction and distress, and maintaining the conflict with great fortitude; whilst thou art not yet brought to this conflict? It is in thy power if thou wilt, without entering into the course, to be a sharer of the crowns reserved for him, by standing by him, preparing his mind, and animating and exciting him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:45
verses.text: Hence it is that Paul elsewhere says, "Ye have done well that ye did communicate with my affliction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:46
verses.text: For even in Thessalonica ye sent once and again unto my necessity".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:47
verses.text: (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:48
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:50
verses.text: ) And how could they that were far off share in the affliction of him that was not with them? How? He says, "ye sent once and again unto my necessities".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:51
verses.text: Again he says, speaking of Epaphroditus, "Because he was nigh unto death, not regarding his life, that he might supply your lack of service toward me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:52
verses.text: (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:53
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:54
verses.text: ) For as in the service of kings, not only those who fight the battle, but those who guard the baggage, share in the honor; and not merely so, but frequently even have an equal portion of the spoils, though they have not imbrued their hands in blood, nor stood in array, nor even seen the ranks of the enemy; so it is in these conflicts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:55
verses.text: For he who relieves the combatant, when wasted with hunger, who stands by him, encouraging him by words, and rendering him every service, he is not inferior to the combatant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:56
verses.text: For do not suppose Paul the combatant, that irresistible and invincible one, but some one of the many, who, if he had not received much consolation and encouragement, would not perhaps have stood, would not have contended.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:57
verses.text: So those who are out of the contest may perchance be the cause of victory to him, who is engaged in it, and may be partakers of the crowns reserved for the victor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:58
verses.text: And what wonder, if he who communicates to the living is thought worthy of the same rewards with those who contend, since it is possible to communicate after death even with the departed, with those who are asleep, who are already crowned, who want for nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:59
verses.text: For hear Paul saying, "Partaking in the memories of the Saints".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:60
verses.text: And how may this be done? When thou admirest a man, when thou doest any of those acts for which he was crowned, thou art evidently a sharer in his labors, and in his crowns.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 4:61
