verses.text: But how is it their names are nowhere else introduced? Either they were handed down by tradition, or it is probable that Paul knew them by inspiration.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:77
verses.text: "Men of corrupt minds," he says, "reprobate concerning the faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:78
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:79
verses.text: "But they shall proceed no further; for their folly shall be manifested unto all men, as theirs also was".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:80
verses.text: "They shall proceed no further"; how then does he say elsewhere, "They will increase unto more ungodliness"? ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:81
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:82
verses.text: ) He there means, that beginning to innovate and to deceive, they will not pause in their error, but will always invent new deceits and corrupt doctrines, for error is never stationary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:83
verses.text: But here he says, that they shall not be able to deceive, nor carry men away with them, for however at first they may seem to impose upon them, they will soon and easily be detected.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:84
verses.text: For that he is speaking to this effect appears from what follows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:85
verses.text: "For their folly shall be manifest unto all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:86
verses.text: Whence? Every way"as theirs also was".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:87
verses.text: For if errors flourish at first, they do not continue to the end, for so it is with things that are not fair by nature, but fair in appearance; they flourish for a time, and then are detected, and come to nought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:88
verses.text: But not such are our doctrines, and of these thou art a witness, for in our doctrines there is no deceit, for who would choose to die for a deceit?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:89
verses.text: "But thou hast fully known my doctrine".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:90
verses.text: Wherefore be strong; for thou wert not merely present, but didst follow closely.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:91
verses.text: Here he seems to imply that the period had been long, in that he says, "Thou hast followed up my doctrine"; this refers to his discourse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:92
verses.text: "Manner of life"; this to his conduct.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:93
verses.text: "Purpose"; this to his zeal, and the firmness of his soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:94
verses.text: I did not say these things, he says, and not do them; nor was I a philosopher in words only.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:95
verses.text: "Faith, longsuffering".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:96
verses.text: He means, how none of these things troubled me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:97
verses.text: "Charity," which those men had not; "patience," nor yet this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:98
verses.text: Towards the heretics, he means, I show much longsuffering; "patience," that under persecution.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:99
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:100
verses.text: "Persecutions, afflictions".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:101
verses.text: There are two things that disquiet a teacher, the number of heretics, and men's wanting fortitude to endure sufferings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:102
verses.text: And yet he has said much about these, that such always have been, and always will be, and no age will be free from them, and that they will not be able to injure us, and that in the world there are vessels of gold and of silver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:103
verses.text: You see how he proceeds to discourse about his afflictions, "which came upon me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:104
verses.text: Why has he selected these instances out of many? Because the rest was known to Timothy, and these perhaps were new events, and he does not mention the former ones, for he is not enumerating them particularly, for he is not actuated by ambition or vainglory, but he recounts them for the consolation of his disciple, not from ostentation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:105
verses.text: And here he speaks of Antioch in Pisidia, and Lystra, whence Timothy himself was.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:106
verses.text: "What persecutions I endured".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:107
verses.text: There was twofold matter of consolation, that I displayed a generous zeal, and that I was not forsaken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:108
verses.text: It cannot be said, that God abandoned me, but He rendered my crown more radiant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:109
verses.text: "What persecutions I endured: but out of them all the Lord delivered me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:110
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:111
verses.text: "Yea, and all those that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:112
verses.text: But why, he says, should I speak only of myself? Each one that will live godly will be persecuted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:113
verses.text: Here he calls afflictions and sorrows, "persecutions," for it is not possible that a man pursuing the course of virtue should not be exposed to grief, tribulation, and temptations.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:114
verses.text: For how can he escape it who is treading in the strait and narrow way, and who has heard, that "in the world ye shall have tribulation"? (John xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:115
verses.text: ) If Job in his time said, "The life of man upon earth is a state of trial" (Job vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:116
verses.text: , Gr.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:117
verses.text: ); how much more was it so in those days?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:118
verses.text: "But evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving, and being deceived".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:119
verses.text: Let none of these things, he says, disturb thee, if they are in prosperity, and thou in trials.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:120
verses.text: Such is the nature of the case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:121
verses.text: From my own instance thou mayest learn that it is impossible for man, in his warfare with the wicked, not to be exposed to tribulation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:122
verses.text: One cannot be in combat and live luxuriously, one cannot be wrestling and feasting.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:123
verses.text: Let none therefore of those who are contending seek for ease or joyous living.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:124
verses.text: Again, the present state is contest, warfare, tribulation, straits, and trials, and the very scene of conflicts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:125
verses.text: The season for rest is not now, this is the time for toil and labor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:126
verses.text: No one who has just stripped and anointed himself thinks of ease.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:127
verses.text: If thou thinkest of ease, why didst thou strip, or prepare to fight? "But do I not maintain the fight?" you say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:128
verses.text: What, when thou dost not conquer thy desires, nor resist the evil bias of nature?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:129
verses.text: "But continue thou in the things that thou hast learned and hast been assured of, knowing of whom thou hast learned them; And that from a child thou hast known the holy Scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through the faith which in Christ Jesus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:130
verses.text: What is this? As the prophet David exhorted, saying, "Be not thou envious against the workers of iniquity" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:131
verses.text: xxxvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:132
verses.text: ), so Paul exhorts, "Continue thou in the things which thou hast learned," and not simply learned, but "hast been assured of," that is, hast believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:133
verses.text: And what have I believed? That this is the Life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:134
verses.text: And if thou seest things happening contrary to thy belief, be not troubled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:135
verses.text: The same happened to Abraham, yet he was not affected at it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:136
verses.text: He had heard, "In Isaac shall thy seed be called" (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:137
verses.text: xxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:138
verses.text: ); and he was commanded to sacrifice Isaac, yet he was not troubled nor dismayed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:139
verses.text: Let no one be offended because of the wicked.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:140
verses.text: This the Scripture taught from the beginning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:141
verses.text: What then, if the good be in prosperity, and the wicked be punished? The one is likely to happen, the other not so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:142
verses.text: For the wicked will possibly be punished, but the good cannot always be rejoicing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:143
verses.text: No one was equal to Paul, yet he passed all his life in afflictions, in tears and groanings night and day.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:144
verses.text: "For the space of three years," he says, "I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:145
verses.text: (Acts xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:146
verses.text: ) And again: "That which cometh upon me daily".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:147
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:148
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:149
verses.text: ) He did not rejoice to-day, and grieve to-morrow, but he ceased not daily to grieve.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:150
verses.text: How then does he say, "Evil men shall wax worse and worse"? He has not said, they shall find rest, but "they shall wax worse and worse".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:151
verses.text: Their progress is for the worse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:152
verses.text: He has not said, they shall be in prosperity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:153
verses.text: But if they are punished, they are punished that thou mayest not suppose their sins are unavenged.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:154
verses.text: For since we are not deterred from wickedness by the fear of hell, in very tenderness He rouses us from our insensibility, and awakens us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:155
verses.text: If no wicked man was ever punished, no one would believe that God presides over human affairs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:156
verses.text: If all were punished, no one would expect a future resurrection, since all had received their due here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:157
verses.text: On this account He both punishes, and forbears to punish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:158
verses.text: On this account the righteous suffer tribulation here, because they are sojourners, and strangers, and are in a foreign country.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:159
verses.text: The just therefore endure these things for the purpose of trial.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:160
verses.text: For hear what God said to Job: "Thinkest thou that I have warned thee otherwise, than that thou mightest appear just?" (Job xl.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:161
verses.text: , Gr.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:162
verses.text: ) But sinners when they endure any affliction suffer but the punishment of their sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:163
verses.text: Under all circumstances, therefore, whether afflictive or otherwise, let us give thanks to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:164
verses.text: For both are beneficial.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:165
verses.text: He does nothing in hatred or enmity to us, but all things from care and consideration for us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:166
verses.text: "Knowing that from a child thou hast known the sacred writings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:167
verses.text: The holy Scriptures he calls "sacred writings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:168
verses.text: In these thou wast nurtured, so that through them thy faith ought to be firm and unshaken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:169
verses.text: For the root was laid deep, and nourished by length of time, nor will anything subvert it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:170
verses.text: And speaking of the holy Scriptures, he has added, "Which are able to make thee wise," that is, they will not suffer thee to have any foolish feeling, such as most men have.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:171
verses.text: For he who knows the Scriptures as he ought, is not offended at anything that happens; he endures all things manfully, referring them partly to faith, and to the incomprehensible nature of the divine dispensation, and partly knowing reasons for them, and finding examples in the Scriptures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:172
verses.text: Since it is a great sign of knowledge not to be curious about everything, nor to wish to know all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:173
verses.text: And if you will allow me, I will explain myself by an example.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:174
verses.text: Let us suppose a river, or rather rivers (I ask no allowance, I only speak of what rivers really are,) all are not of the same depth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:175
verses.text: Some have a shallow bed, others one deep enough to drown one unacquainted with it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:176
verses.text: In one part there are whirlpools, and not in another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:177
verses.text: It is good therefore to forbear to make trial of all, and it is no small proof of knowledge not to wish to sound all the depths: whereas he that would venture on every part of the river, is really most ignorant of the peculiar nature of rivers, and will often be in danger of perishing, from venturing into the deeper parts with the same boldness with which he crossed the shallows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:178
verses.text: So it is in the things of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:179
verses.text: He that will know all things, and ventures to intrude into everything, he it is that is most ignorant what God is.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:180
verses.text: And of rivers indeed, the greater part is safe, and the depths and whirlpools few, but with respect to the things of God, the greater part is hidden, and it is not possible to trace out His works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:181
verses.text: Why then art thou bent on drowning thyself in those depths?  Know this, however, that God dispenses all things, that He provides for all, that we are free agents, that some things He works, and some things He permits; that He wills nothing evil to be done; that all things are not done by His will, but some by ours also; all evil things by ours alone, all good things by our will conjointly with His influence; and that nothing is without His knowledge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:182
verses.text: Therefore He worketh all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:183
verses.text: Thou then knowing this canst reckon what things are good, what are evil, and what are indifferent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:184
verses.text: Thus virtue is good, vice is evil; but riches and poverty, life and death, are things indifferent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:185
verses.text: If thou knowest this, thou wilt know thereby, that the righteous are afflicted that they may be crowned, the wicked, that they may receive the punishment of their sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:186
verses.text: But all sinners are not punished here, lest the generality should disbelieve the Resurrection; nor all the righteous afflicted, lest men should think that vice, and not virtue, is approved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:187
verses.text: These are the rules and limits.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:188
verses.text: Bring what you will to the test of these, and you will not be perplexed with doubt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:189
verses.text: For as there is among calculators the number of six thousand, to which all things can be reduced, and everything can be divided and multiplied in the scale of six thousand, and this is known to all who are acquainted with arithmetic; so he who knows those rules, which I will briefly recapitulate, will never be offended.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:190
verses.text: And what are these? That virtue is a good, vice an evil; that diseases, poverty, ill-treatment, false accusations, and the like, are things indifferent; that the righteous are afflicted here, or if ever they are in prosperity, it is that virtue may not appear odious; that the wicked enjoy pleasure now that hereafter they may be punished, or if they are sometimes visited, it is that vice may not seem to be approved, nor their actions to go unpunished; that all are not punished, lest there should be a disbelief of the time of resurrection; that even of the good, some who have done bad actions are quit of them here; and of the wicked, some have good ones, and are rewarded for them here, that their wickedness may be punished hereafter (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:191
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:192
verses.text: ); that the works of God are for the most part incomprehensible, and that the difference between us and Him is greater than can be expressed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:193
verses.text: If we reason on these grounds, nothing will be able to trouble or perplex us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:194
verses.text: If we listen to the Scriptures continually, we shall find many such examples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:195
verses.text: "Which are able," he says, "to make thee wise unto salvation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:196
verses.text: For the Scriptures suggest to us what is to be done, and what is not to be done.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:197
verses.text: For hear this blessed one elsewhere saying, "Thou art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them which are in darkness, an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:198
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:199
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:201
verses.text: ) Thou seest that the Law is the light of them which are in darkness; and if that which showeth the letter, the letter which killeth, is light, what then is the Spirit which quickeneth? If the Old Covenant is light, what is the New, which contains so many, and so great revelations? where the difference is as great, as if any one should open heaven to those who only know the earth, and make all things there visible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:202
verses.text: There we learn concerning hell, heaven, and judgment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:203
verses.text: Let us not believe in things irrational.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:204
verses.text: They are nothing but imposture.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:205
verses.text: "What," you say, "when what they foretell comes to pass?" It is because you believe it, if it does come to pass.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:206
verses.text: The impostor has taken thee captive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:207
verses.text: Thy life is in his power, he manages thee as he will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:208
verses.text: If a captain of robbers should have under his power and disposal the son of a king, who had fled to him, preferring the desert, and his lawless company, would he be able to pronounce whether he would live or die? Assuredly he would, not because he knows the future, but because he is the disposer of his life or death, the youth having put himself in his power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:209
verses.text: For according to his own pleasure, he may either kill him, or spare his life, as he is become subject to him, and it is equally at his disposal to say whether thou shalt be rich or poor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:210
verses.text: The greater part of the world have delivered themselves up into the hands of the devil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:211
verses.text: And furthermore, it contributes much to favor the pretenses of these deceivers, that a man has accustomed himself to believe in them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:212
verses.text: For no one takes notice of their failures, but their lucky conjectures are observed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:213
verses.text: But if these men have any power of prognosticating, bring them to me, a believer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:214
verses.text: I say not this, as magnifying myself, (for it is no great honor to be superior to these things,) and indeed I am deep-laden with sins; but with respect to these matters, I will not be humble-minded; by the grace of God I despise them all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:215
verses.text: Bring me this pretender to magic; let him, if he has any power of prognosticating, tell me what will happen to me to-morrow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:216
verses.text: But he will not tell me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:217
verses.text: For I am under the power of the King, and he has no claim to my allegiance or submission.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:218
verses.text: I am far from his holes and caverns.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:219
verses.text: I war under the king.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:220
verses.text: "But some one committed theft," you say, "and this man discovered it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:221
verses.text: This is not always true, certainly, but for the most part absurdities and falsehoods.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:222
verses.text: For they know nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:223
verses.text: If indeed they know anything, they ought rather to speak of their own concerns, how the numerous offerings to their idols have been stolen, how so much of their gold has been melted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:224
verses.text: Why have they not informed their Priests? Even for the sake of money, they have not been able to give information when their idol-temples have been burnt, and many have perished with them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:225
verses.text: Why do they not provide for their own safety? But it is altogether a matter of chance, if they have predicted anything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:226
verses.text: With us there are prophets, and they do not fail.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:227
verses.text: They do not speak truth in one instance and falsehood in another, but always declare the truth; for this is the privilege of foreknowledge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:228
verses.text: Cease, then, from this madness, I beseech you, if at least you believe in Christ; and if you believe not, why do you expose yourselves? Why do you deceive? "How long will ye halt on both your hips?" ( Kings xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:229
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:230
verses.text: ) Why do you go to them? Why enquire of them? The instant you go to them, the instant you enquire, you put yourself in slavery to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:231
verses.text: For you enquire, as if you believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:232
verses.text: "No," you say, "I do not enquire, as believing, but making trial of them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:233
verses.text: But to make trial, whether they speak the truth, is the part not of one who believes that they are false, but of one who still doubts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:234
verses.text: Wherefore then dost thou enquire what will happen? For if they answered, "This will happen, but do so and so, and thou wilt escape it"; even in that case thou oughtest by no means to be an idolater; yet thy madness were not so great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:235
verses.text: But if they foretell future events, he that listens to them will gain nothing more than unavailing sorrow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:236
verses.text: The event does not happen, but he suffers the uneasiness, and torments, himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:237
verses.text: If it were for our good, God would not have grudged us this foreknowledge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:238
verses.text: He who has revealed to us things in heaven, would not have envied us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:239
verses.text: For, "All things," He says, "that I have heard of the Father I have made known unto you"; and, "I call you not servants, but friends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:240
verses.text: Ye are my friends".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:241
verses.text: (John xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:242
verses.text: ) Why then did He not make these things known unto us? Because He would not have us concerned about them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:243
verses.text: And as a proof that He does not envy us this knowledge, such things were revealed to the ancients, because they were babes, even about an ass, and the like.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:244
verses.text: But to us, because He would not have us concerned about such things, He has not cared to reveal them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:245
verses.text: But what do we learn? Things which they never knew, for little indeed were all those things of old.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:246
verses.text: But what we are taught is this, that we shall rise again, that we shall be immortal, and incorruptible, that our life shall have no end, that all things will pass away, that we shall be caught up in the clouds, that the wicked shall suffer punishment, and numberless other things, and in all these there is no falsehood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:247
verses.text: Is it not better to know these than to hear that the ass that was lost is found? Lo, thou hast gotten thine ass! Lo, thou hast found him! What is thy gain? Will he not soon be lost again some other way? For if he leave thee not, at least thou wilt lose him in thy death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:248
verses.text: But the things which I have mentioned, if we will but hold them fast, we shall retain perpetually.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:249
verses.text: These therefore let us pursue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:250
verses.text: To these stable and enduring goods let us attach ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:251
verses.text: Let us not give heed to soothsayers, fortune-tellers, and jugglers, but to God who knoweth all things certainly, whose knowledge is universal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 8:252
verses.text: Thus we shall know all that it befits us to know, and shall obtain all good things, through the grace and lovingkindness, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:1
verses.text: Homily IX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:2
verses.text: Timothy iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:3
verses.text: ,  "All Scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness: That the man of God may be perfect, thoroughly furnished unto all good works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:4
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:5
verses.text: V.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:6
verses.text: : Every Scripture inspired of God is also profitable, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:7
verses.text: Having offered much exhortation and consolation from other sources, he adds that which is more perfect, derived from the Scriptures; and he is reasonably full in offering consolation, because he has a great and sad thing to say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:8
verses.text: For if Elisha, ho was with his master to his last breath, when he saw him departing as it were in death, rent his garments for grief, what think you must this disciple suffer, so loving and so beloved, upon hearing that his master was about to die, and that he could not enjoy his company when he was near his death, which is above all things apt to be distressing? For we are less grateful for the past time, when we have been deprived of the more recent intercourse of those who are departed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:9
verses.text: For this reason when he had previously offered much consolation, he then discourses concerning his own death: and this in no ordinary way, but in words adapted to comfort him and fill him with joy; so as to have it considered as a sacrifice rather than a death; a migration, as in fact it was, and a removal to a better state.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:10
verses.text: "For I am now ready to be offered up" ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:11
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:12
verses.text: ), he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:13
verses.text: For this reason he writes: "All Scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:14
verses.text: All what Scripture? all that sacred writing, he means, of which I was speaking.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:15
verses.text: This is said of what he was discoursing of; about which he said, "From a child thou hast known the holy Scriptures".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:16
verses.text: All such, then, "is given by inspiration of God"; therefore, he means, do not doubt; and it is "profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness: that the man of God may be perfect, thoroughly furnished unto all good works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:17
verses.text: "For doctrine".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:18
verses.text: For thence we shall know, whether we ought to learn or to be ignorant of anything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:19
verses.text: And thence we may disprove what is false, thence we may be corrected and brought to a right mind, may be comforted and consoled, and if anything is deficient, we may have it added to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:20
verses.text: "That the man of God may be perfect".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:21
verses.text: For this is the exhortation of the Scripture given, that the man of God may be rendered perfect by it; without this therefore he cannot be perfect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:22
verses.text: Thou hast the Scriptures, he says, in place of me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:23
verses.text: If thou wouldest learn anything, thou mayest learn it from them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:24
verses.text: And if he thus wrote to Timothy, who was filled with the Spirit, how much more to us!  "Thoroughly furnished unto all good works"; not merely taking part in them, he means, but "thoroughly furnished".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:25
verses.text: Chap.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:26
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:27
verses.text: "I charge thee therefore before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, Who shall judge the quick and the dead".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:28
verses.text: He either means the wicked and the just, or the departed and those that are still living; for many will be left alive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:29
verses.text: In the former Epistle he raised his fears, saying, "I give thee charge in the sight of God, Who quickeneth all things" ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:30
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:31
verses.text: ): but here he sets before him what is more dreadful, "Who shall judge the quick and the dead," that is, Who shall call them to account "at His appearing and His kingdom".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:32
verses.text: When shah He judge? at His appearing with glory, and in His kingdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:33
verses.text: Either he says this to show that He will not come in the way that He now has come, or, "I call to witness His coming, and His kingdom".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:34
verses.text: He calls Him to witness, showing that he had reminded Him of that appearing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:35
verses.text: Then teaching him how he ought to preach the word, he adds,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:36
verses.text: "Preach the word: be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:37
verses.text: What means "in season, out of season"? That is, have not any limited season: let it always be thy season, not only in peace and security, and when sitting in the Church.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:38
verses.text: Whether thou be in danger, in prison, in chains, or going to thy death, at that very time reprove.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:39
verses.text: Withhold not rebuke, for reproof is then most seasonable, when thy rebuke will be most successful, when the reality is proved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:40
verses.text: "Exhort," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:41
verses.text: After the manner of physicians, having shown the wound, he gives the incision, he applies the plaster.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:42
verses.text: For if you omit either of these, the other becomes useless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:43
verses.text: If you rebuke without convicting, you will seem to be rash, and no one will tolerate it, but after the matter is proved, he will submit to rebuke: before, he will be headstrong.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:44
verses.text: And if you convict and rebuke, but vehemently, and do not apply exhortation, all your labor will be lost.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:45
verses.text: For conviction is intolerable in itself if consolation be not mingled with it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:46
verses.text: As if incision, though salutary in itself, have not plenty of lenitives to assuage the pain, the patient cannot endure cutting and hacking, so it is in this matter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:47
verses.text: "With all longsuffering and doctrine".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:48
verses.text: For he that reproves is required to be longsuffering, that he may not believe hastily, and rebuke needs consolation, that it may be received as it ought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:49
verses.text: And why to "longsuffering" does he add "doctrine"? "Not as in anger, not as in hatred, not as insulting over him, not as having caught an enemy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:50
verses.text: Far be these things from thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:51
verses.text: But how? As loving as sympathizing with him, as more distressed than himself at his grief, as melted at his sufferings? "With all longsuffering and doctrine".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:52
verses.text: No ordinary teaching is implied.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:53
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:54
verses.text: "For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:55
verses.text: Before they grow stiffnecked, preoccupy them all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:56
verses.text: For this reason he says, "in season, out of season"; do everything, so as to have willing disciples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:57
verses.text: "But after their own lusts," he says, "shall they heap to themselves teachers".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:58
verses.text: Nothing can be more expressive than these words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:59
verses.text: For by saying "they shall heap to themselves," he shows the indiscriminate multitude of the teachers, as also by their being elected by their disciples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:60
verses.text: "They shall heap to themselves teachers," he says, "having itching ears".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:61
verses.text: Seeking for such as speak to gratify and delight their hearers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:62
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:63
verses.text: "And they shall turn away their ears from the truth, and be turned unto fables".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:64
verses.text: This he foretells, not as willing to throw him into despair, but to prepare him to bear it firmly, when it shall happen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:65
verses.text: As Christ also did in saying, "They will deliver you up, and they will scourge you, and bring you before the synagogues, for My name's sake".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:66
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:67
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:68
verses.text: ) And this blessed man elsewhere says, "For I know this, that after my departures shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:69
verses.text: (Acts xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:70
verses.text: ) But this he said that they might watch, and duly use the present opportunity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:71
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:72
verses.text: "But watch thou in all things, endure affliction".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:73
verses.text: It was for this therefore, that he foretold these things; as Christ also toward the end predicted that there should be "false Christs and false prophets"; so he too, when he was about to depart, spoke of these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:74
verses.text: "But watch thou in all things, endure affliction"; that is, labor, preoccupy their minds before this pestilence assails them; secure the safety of the sheep before the wolves enter in, everywhere endure hardship.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:75
verses.text: "Do the work of an evangelist, make full proof of thy ministry".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:76
verses.text: Thus it was the work of an evangelist that he should endure hardship, both in himself, and from those without; "make full proof of" that is, fulfill "thy ministry".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:77
verses.text: And behold another necessity for his enduring affliction,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:78
verses.text: "For I am now ready to be poured out, and the time of my departure is at hand".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:79
verses.text: He has not said of my sacrifice; but, what is much more, "of my being poured out".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:80
verses.text: For the whole of the sacrifice was not offered to God, but the whole of the drink-offering was.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:81
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:82
verses.text: "I have fought the good fight, I have finished the course, I have kept the faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:83
verses.text: Often, when I have taken the Apostle into my hands, and have considered this passage, I have been at a loss to understand why Paul here speaks so loftily: "I have fought the good fight".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:84
verses.text: But now by the grace of God I seem to have found it out.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:85
verses.text: For what purpose then does he speak thus? He is desirous to console the despondency of his disciple, and therefore bids him be of good cheer, since he was going to his crown, having finished all his work, and obtained a glorious end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:86
verses.text: Thou oughtest to rejoice, he says, not to grieve.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:87
verses.text: And why? Because, "I have fought the good fight".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:88
verses.text: As a father whose son was sitting by him, bewailing his orphan state, might console him, saying, Weep not, my son; we have lived a good life, we have arrived at old age, and now we leave thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:89
verses.text: Our life has been irreproachable, we depart with glory, and thou mayest be held in admiration for our actions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:90
verses.text: Our king is much indebted to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:91
verses.text: As if he had said, We have raised trophies, we have conquered enemies, and this not boastfully.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:92
verses.text: God forbid; but to raise up his dejected son, and to encourage him by his praises to bear firmly what had happened, to entertain good hopes, and not to think it a matter grievous to be borne.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:93
verses.text: For sad, sad indeed is separation; and hear Paul himself, saying, "We being bereaved of you for a short time, in presence, not in heart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:94
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:95
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:96
verses.text: ) If he then felt so much at being separated from his disciples, what thinkest thou were the feelings of Timothy? If on parting from him whilst living he wept, so that Paul says, "Being mindful of thy tears, that I may be filled with joy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:97
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:98
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:99
verses.text: ), how much more at his death? These things then he wrote to console him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:100
verses.text: Indeed the whole Epistle is full of consolation, and is a sort of Testament.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:101
verses.text: "I have fought the good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:102
verses.text: "A good fight," he says, therefore do thou engage in it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:103
verses.text: But is that a good fight, where there are imprisonment, chains, and death? Yea, he says for it is fought in the cause of Christ, and great crowns are won in it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:104
verses.text: "The good fight"! There is no worthier than this contest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:105
verses.text: This crown is without end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:106
verses.text: This is not of olive leaves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:107
verses.text: It has not a human umpire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:108
verses.text: It has not men for spectators.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:109
verses.text: The theater is crowded with Angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:110
verses.text: There men labor many days, and suffer hardships, and for one hour they receive the crown, and immediately all the pleasure passes away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:111
verses.text: But here far otherwise, it continues for ever in brightness, glory, and honor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:112
verses.text: Henceforth we ought to rejoice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:113
verses.text: For I am entering on my rest, I am leaving the race.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:114
verses.text: Thou hast heard that "it is better to depart and to be with Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:115
verses.text: I have finished "the course".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:116
verses.text: For it behooves us both to contend and to run; to contend, by enduring afflictions firmly, and to run, not vainly, but to some good end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:117
verses.text: It is truly a good fight, not only delighting, but benefiting the spectator: and the race does not end in nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:118
verses.text: It is not a mere display of strength and of rivalry.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:119
verses.text: It draws all up to heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:120
verses.text: This race is brighter than the sun's, yea, this which Paul ran upon earth, than that which he runs in heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:121
verses.text: And how had he "finished his course"? He traversed the whole world, beginning from Galilee and Arabia, and advancing to the extremities of the each, so that, as he says, "From Jerusalem and round about unto Illyricum I have fully preached the Gospel of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:122
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:123
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:124
verses.text: ) He passed over the earth like a bird, or rather more swiftly than a bird: for a bird only flies over it, but he, having the wing of the Spirit, made his way through numberless impediments, dangers, deaths, and calamities, so that he was even fleeter than a bird.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:125
verses.text: Had he been a mere bird, he might have alighted and been taken, but being upborne by the Spirit he soared above all snares, as a bird with a wing of fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:126
verses.text: "I have kept the faith," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:127
verses.text: There were many things that would have robbed him of it, not only human friendships, but menaces, and death, and countless other perils: but he stood firm against all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:128
verses.text: How? by being sober and watchful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:129
verses.text: This might have sufficed for the consolation of his disciples, but he further adds the rewards.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:130
verses.text: And what are these?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:131
verses.text: "Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:132
verses.text: Here again he calls virtue in general righteousness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:133
verses.text: Thou shouldest not grieve that I shall depart, to be invested with that crown which will by Christ be placed upon my head.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:134
verses.text: But if I continued here, truly thy mightest rather grieve, and fear lest I should fail and perish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:135
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:136
verses.text: "Which the Lord, the righteous Judge, shall give me at that day, and not to me only, but to all that love His appearing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:137
verses.text: Here also he raises his mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:138
verses.text: If "to all," much more to Timothy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:139
verses.text: But he did not say, "and to thee," but "to all"; meaning, if to all, much more to him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:140
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:141
verses.text: But how, it may be asked, is one to "love the appearing" ( ) of Christ? By rejoicing at His coming; and he who rejoices at His coming, will perform works worthy of His joy; he will throw away his substance if need be, and even his life, so that he may obtain future blessings, that he may be thought worthy to behold that second coming in a fitting state, in confidence, in brightness and glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:142
verses.text: This is to "love His appearing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:143
verses.text: He who loves His appearing will do everything to ensure, before His general coming, a particular coming to himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:144
verses.text: And how, you will say, is this possible? Hear from Christ, who says, "If a man love Me, he will keep My words, and My Father and I will come unto him, and make Our abode with him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:145
verses.text: (John xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:146
verses.text: ) And think how great a privilege it is that He who will appear to all generally, should promise to come to us in particular: for He says, "We will come and make Our abode with him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:147
verses.text: If any man "love His appearing," he will do everything to invite Him to himself, and to hold Him, that the light may shine upon him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:148
verses.text: Let there be nothing unworthy of His coming, and He will soon take up His abode with us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:149
verses.text: And it is called His "Epiphany," because He will appear above, and shine forth from on high.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:150
verses.text: Let us therefore "seek those things that are above," and we shall soon draw down those beams upon us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:151
verses.text: None of those who grovel below, and bury themselves in this lower earth, will be able to view the light of that Sun.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:152
verses.text: None of those who defile themselves with worldly things will be able to behold that Sun of righteousness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:153
verses.text: He shines on none of those who are so occupied.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:154
verses.text: Recover thyself a little, recover thyself from that depth, from the waves of a worldly life, if thou wouldest see the Sun, and enjoy His appearing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:155
verses.text: Then thou wilt see Him with great confidence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:156
verses.text: Be even now a philosopher.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:157
verses.text: Let not a spirit of perverseness possess thee, lest He smite thee severely, and bring thee low.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:158
verses.text: Let not thy heart be hardened; nor darkened, lest thou be shipwrecked there.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:159
verses.text: Let there be no self-deceit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:160
verses.text: For the rocks beneath the sea cause the most fatal shipwrecks.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:161
verses.text: Nourish no wild beasts, I mean evil passions, worse than wild beasts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:162
verses.text: Confide not in things ever flowing, that thou mayest be able to stand firmly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:163
verses.text: None can stand upon water, but upon a rock all find a secure footing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:164
verses.text: Worldly things are as water, as a torrent, that passes away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:165
verses.text: "The waters," he saith, "are come in unto my soul".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:166
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:167
verses.text: lxix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:168
verses.text: ) Spiritual things are as a rock.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:169
verses.text: For he saith, "Thou hast set my feet upon a rock".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:170
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:171
verses.text: xl.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:172
verses.text: ) Worldly things are as mire and clay; let us extricate ourselves from them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:173
verses.text: For so we shall be able to attain to the appearing of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:174
verses.text: Whatever may befall us, let us endure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:175
verses.text: It is a sufficient consolation in all circumstances that we suffer for Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:176
verses.text: This divine incantation let us repeat, and it will charm away the pain of every wound.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:177
verses.text: And how can we suffer for Christ, you ask? If one accuse thee falsely in any case, not on account of Christ, yet if thou bearest it patiently, if thou givest thanks, if thou prayest for him, all this thou doest for Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:178
verses.text: But if thou curse him, if thou utter discontent, if thou attempt to revenge it, though thou shouldest not be able, it is not for Christ's sake; thou sufferest loss, and art deprived of thy reward on account of thy intention.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:179
verses.text: For it rests with us either to profit, or to be injured, by afflictions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:180
verses.text: It depends not upon the nature of the affliction, but upon the disposition of our own minds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:181
verses.text: As, for instance, great were the sufferings of Job, yet he suffered with thankfulness; and he was justified, not because he suffered, but because in suffering he endured it thankfully.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:182
verses.text: Another under the same sufferings, yet not the same, for none ever suffered like Jobbut under lighter sufferings, exclaims, is impatient, curses the whole world, and complains against God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:183
verses.text: He is condemned and sentenced, not because he suffered, but because he blasphemed; and he blasphemed, not from any necessity arising from his afflictions, since if necessity arising from events were the cause, Job too must have blasphemed; but since he, who suffered more severely, did no such thing, it did not come to pass from this cause, but from the man's weakness of purpose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:184
verses.text: We want therefore strength of soul, and nothing will then appear grievous, but if our soul is weak, we find a grievance in everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:185
verses.text: According to our dispositions, all things become tolerable or intolerable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:186
verses.text: Let us strengthen our resolution, and we shall bear all things easily.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:187
verses.text: The tree whose roots are fixed deep in the earth is not shaken by the utmost violence of the storm, but if it be set lightly in the surface of the ground, a slight gust of wind will tear it up from the roots.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:188
verses.text: So it is with us; if our flesh be nailed down by the fear of God, nothing will be able to shake us; but if we merely intend well, a little shock will subvert and destroy us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:189
verses.text: Wherefore, I exhort, let us bear all with much cheerfulness, imitating the Prophet, who says, "My soul cleaveth to Thee"; observe, he says not, draweth nigh, but "cleaveth to Thee"; and again, "My soul thirsteth for Thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:190
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:191
verses.text: lxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:192
verses.text: ) He said not merely "longeth," that he might by such words express the vehemence of his desire; and again, "Fix my flesh in Thy fear".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:193
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:194
verses.text: cxix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:195
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:196
verses.text: ) For he wishes us so to cleave and be united to Him, that we may never be separated from Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 9:197
verses.text: If thus we hold by God, if thus we rivet our thoughts upon Him, if we thirst with the love of Him, all that we desire will be ours, and we shall obtain the good things to come, in Jesus Christ our Lord, to whom with the Father and the Holy Ghost be glory, power, and honor, now and for ever, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:1
verses.text: Homily X.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:2
verses.text: Timothy iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:3
verses.text: "Do thy diligence to come shortly unto me: For Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world, and is departed unto Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:4
verses.text: Only Luke is with me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:5
verses.text: Take Mark, and bring him with thee: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:6
verses.text: And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:7
verses.text: The cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest, bring with thee, and the books, but especially the parchments".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:8
verses.text: It is worth while to enquire why he calls Timothy to him, inasmuch as he was intrusted with a Church, and a whole nation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:9
verses.text: It was not from arrogance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:10
verses.text: For Paul was ready to come to him; for we find him saying, "But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:11
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:12
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:13
verses.text: ) But he was withholden by a strong necessity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:14
verses.text: He was no longer master of his own movements.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:15
verses.text: He was in prison, and had been confined by Nero, and was all but on the point of death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:16
verses.text: That this might not happen before he saw his disciple, he therefore sends for him, desiring to see him before he dies, and perhaps to deliver much in charge to him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:17
verses.text: Wherefore he says, "Hasten to come to me before the winter".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:18
verses.text: "For Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:19
verses.text: He does not say, "That I may see thee before I depart this life," which would have grieved him, but "because I am alone," he says, "and have no one to help or support me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:20
verses.text: "For Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world, and is departed to Thessalonica"; that is, having loved his own ease and security from danger, he has chosen rather to live luxuriously at home, than to suffer hardships with me, and share my present danger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:21
verses.text: He has blamed him alone, not for the sake of blaming him, but to confirm us, that we may not be effeminate in declining toils and dangers, for this is, "having loved this present world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:22
verses.text: At the same time he wishes to draw his disciple to him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:23
verses.text: "Crescens to Galatia, Titus to Dalmatia".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:24
verses.text: These he does not censure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:25
verses.text: For Titus was one of the most admirable men, so that to him he intrusted the affairs of the island, no small island, I mean, but that great one of Crete.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:26
verses.text: "Only Luke is with me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:27
verses.text: For he adhered to him inseparably.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:28
verses.text: It was he who wrote the Gospel, and the General Acts; he was devoted to labors, and to learning, and a man of fortitude; of him Paul writes, "whose praise is in the Gospel throughout all the Churches".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:29
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:30
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:31
verses.text: )  "Take Mark, and bring him with thee, for he is profitable to me for the ministry".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:32
verses.text: It is not for his own relief, but for the ministry of the Gospel that he wanted him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:33
verses.text: For though imprisoned, he did not cease to preach.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:34
verses.text: So it was on the same account he sent for Timothy, not for his own, but for the Gospel's sake, that his death might occasion no disturbance to the faithful, when many of his own disciples were present to prevent tumults, and to console those who would scarce have endurance to bear up at his death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:35
verses.text: For it is probable that the believers at Rome were men of consequence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:36
verses.text: "And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:37
verses.text: The cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest bring with thee, and the books, but especially the parchments".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:38
verses.text: The word here translated "cloak" may mean a garment, or, as some say, a bag, in which the books were contained.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:39
verses.text: But what had he to do with books, who was about to depart and go to God? He needed them much, that he might deposit them in the hands of the faithful, who would retain them in place of his own teaching.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:40
verses.text: All the faithful, then, would suffer a great blow, but particularly those who were present at his death, and then enjoyed his society.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:41
verses.text: But the cloak he requires, that he might not be obliged to receive one from another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:42
verses.text: For we see him making a great point of avoiding this; and elsewhere, when he was addressing those from Ephesus, he says, "Ye know that these hands have ministered to my necessities, and to those that were with me" (Acts xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:44
verses.text: ); and again, "It is more blessed to give than to receive".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:45
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:46
verses.text: "Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil; the Lord reward him according to his works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:47
verses.text: Here he again makes mention of his trial, not wishing merely to censure and accuse the man, but to prepare his disciple for the conflicts, that he might bear them firmly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:48
verses.text: Though they be mean and contemptible persons, and without honor, who cause these trials, they ought all, he says, to be borne with fortitude.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:49
verses.text: For he who suffers wrong from any great personage, receives no little distinction from the superiority of him who does the wrong.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:50
verses.text: But he who is injured by a vile and abject person, suffers the greater annoyance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:51
verses.text: "He did me much evil," he says, that is, he persecuted me in various ways.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:52
verses.text: But these things will not go unpunished! For the Lord will reward him according to his works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:53
verses.text: As he said above: "What persecutions I endured, but out of them all the Lord delivered me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:54
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:55
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:56
verses.text: ) So also here he consoles his disciples by a double consideration, that he himself had suffered wrong, and that the other would be rewarded for his evil deeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:57
verses.text: Not that the Saints rejoice in the punishment of their persecutors, but that the cause of the Gospel required it, and the weaker would derive consolation from it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:58
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:59
verses.text: "Of whom be thou ware also; for he hath greatly withstood our words".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:60
verses.text: That is, he is hostile to us, and opposes us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:61
verses.text: He has not said, Revenge, punish, expel him, although by the grace given him he might have so done, but he does no such thing; nor does he arm Timothy against him, but only commands him to avoid him, leaving vengeance to God, and for the consolation of the weaker he has said that He will reward him, which is a prophecy rather than an imprecation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:62
verses.text: And that he says these things to prepare the mind of his disciple, is manifest also from what follows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:63
verses.text: But see how he mentions other of his trials.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:64
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:65
verses.text: "At my first answer," he says, "no man stood with me, but all men forsook me: I pray God that it may not be laid to their charge".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:66
verses.text: Do you see how he spares his friends, notwithstanding it was a grievous thing they had done? For it is not the same thing to be despised by aliens, as by our own friends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:67
verses.text: Do you see his intense dejection? It cannot be said, that I was assailed by those without, but had comfort in the attention and support of my friends; for these also betrayed me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:68
verses.text: "All men," he says, "forsook me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:69
verses.text: And this was no light offense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:70
verses.text: For if he that in war abandons one who is exposed to danger, and shrinks from meeting the hands of his enemies, is justly smitten by his friends, as having utterly betrayed their cause, much more in the case of the Gospel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:71
verses.text: But what "first answer," does he speak of? He had stood before Nero, and had escaped.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:72
verses.text: But afterwards, because he had converted his cup-bearer, he was beheaded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:73
verses.text: And here again is encouragement for his disciple in what follows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:74
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:75
verses.text: "Notwithstanding the Lord stood with me, and strengthened me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:76
verses.text: Though deserted by man, God doth not permit him to suffer any harm.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:77
verses.text: He strengthened me, he says, that is, He gave me boldness in speaking.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:78
verses.text: He suffered me not to sink.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:79
verses.text: "That by me the preaching might be fully known".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:80
verses.text: That is, might be fulfilled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:81
verses.text: Observe his great humility.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:82
verses.text: He does not say He strengthened me as deserving of His gift, but that "the preaching," with which I was intrusted, "might be fully known".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:83
verses.text: As if any one should wear a purple robe and a diadem, and to that circumstance should owe his safety.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:84
verses.text: "And that all the Gentiles might hear".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:85
verses.text: What is this? That the luster of the Gospel, and the care of His Providence for me, might be known to all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:86
verses.text: "And I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:87
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:88
verses.text: "And the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:89
verses.text: See how near he had been to death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:90
verses.text: He had fallen into the very jaws of the lion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:91
verses.text: For he calls Nero a lion from his ferocity, and the violent and daring character of his government.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:92
verses.text: "The Lord delivered me," he says, "and will deliver".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:93
verses.text: But if he says, "He will deliver me," why does he say, "I am ready to be offered"? Attend to the expression, "He delivered me," he says, "from the lion's mouth"; and again, "He will deliver me," not from the lion's mouth, but "from every evil work".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:94
verses.text: For then He delivered me from the danger; but now that enough has been done for the Gospel, He will yet again deliver me from every sin, that is, He will not suffer me to depart with condemnation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:95
verses.text: For that he should be able to "resist unto blood striving against sin" (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:96
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:97
verses.text: ), and not yield, is a deliverance from another lion, even the devil, so that this preservation is greater than the former when he seems to be given up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:98
verses.text: "And will preserve me unto His heavenly kingdom; to Whom be glory for ever and ever, Amen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:99
verses.text: This then is salvation, when we shine forth there.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:100
verses.text: But what means, "He will preserve me unto His kingdom"? He will deliver me from all blame, and preserve me there.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:101
verses.text: For this is to be preserved unto His kingdom, to die here on account of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:102
verses.text: For "He that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:103
verses.text: (John xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:104
verses.text: )  "To whom be glory".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:105
verses.text: Lo, here is a doxology to the Son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:106
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:107
verses.text: "Salute Priscilla and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:108
verses.text: For he was then in Rome, of whom he said "The Lord grant unto him that he may find mercy of the Lord in that day".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:109
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:110
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:111
verses.text: ) By this naming of him, he makes those of his household also more zealous in such good actions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:112
verses.text: "Salute Priscilla and Aquila".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:113
verses.text: These are they of whom he makes continual mention, with whom too he had lodged, and who had taken Apollos to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:114
verses.text: He names the woman first, as being I suppose more zealous, and more faithful, for she had then received Apollos; or it might be done indifferently.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:115
verses.text: And it was to them no slight consolation to be thus saluted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:116
verses.text: It conveyed a demonstration of esteem and love, and a participation in much grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:117
verses.text: For the bare salutation of that holy and blessed man was sufficient to fill with grace him who received it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:118
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:119
verses.text: "Erastus abode at Corinth: but Trophimus have I left at Miletum sick".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:120
verses.text: This Trophimus and Tychicus, we know from the book of the Acts, sailed away with him from Judea, and were everywhere his companions, perhaps as being more zealous than the rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:121
verses.text: "Trophimus I have left at Miletum sick".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:122
verses.text: Why then didst thou not heal him, instead of leaving him? The Apostles could not do everything, or they did not dispense miraculous gifts upon all occasions, lest more should be ascribed to them than was right.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:123
verses.text: The same thing is observable of those blessed and righteous men, who were before them, as in the case of Moses, whose voice was weak.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:124
verses.text: Why was not this defect removed? Nay, he was often afflicted with grief and dejection, and he was not admitted into the Land of Promise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:125
verses.text: For many things were permitted by God, that the weakness of human nature might be manifested.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:126
verses.text: And if with these defects the insensible Jews could ask, Where is Moses who brought us out of the land of Egypt (Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:127
verses.text: xxxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:128
verses.text: )? how would they not have been affected towards him if he had brought them also into the Land of Promise? If he had not been suffered to be overpowered by the fear of Pharaoh, would they not have thought him a God? We see that the people of Lystra were thus affected in the case of Paul and Barnabas, thinking them to be Gods, when they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying out and saying, "Sirs, why do ye these things? we also are men of like passions with you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:129
verses.text: (Acts xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:131
verses.text: ) Peter, again, when he had healed the man lame from his birth, when all were amazed at the miracle, answered and said, "Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this, or why look ye so earnestly on us, as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man to walk"? (Acts iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:132
verses.text: ) Hear also the blessed Paul, saying, "There was given to me a thorn in the flesh, lest I should be exalted above measure".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:133
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:134
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:135
verses.text: ) But this, you say, was an expression of humility.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:136
verses.text: Far from it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:137
verses.text: The thorn was not sent him that he might be humble, nor does he say this only out of humility.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:138
verses.text: There are other causes besides to be assigned for it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:139
verses.text: Observe therefore how God, accounting for it, says, "My grace is sufficient for thee"; not "that thou mayest not be exalted above measure," but what? "For my strength is made perfect in weakness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:140
verses.text: Two ends therefore were answered at once: what was doing was made clearly manifest, and the whole was ascribed to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:141
verses.text: For this cause he has said elsewhere, "We carry this treasure in earthen vessels" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:142
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:143
verses.text: ); that is, in bodies weak and liable to suffering.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:144
verses.text: Why? "That the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:145
verses.text: If our bodies were not subject to infirmity, all would be ascribed to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:146
verses.text: And elsewhere we see him grieving at the infirmity of Epaphroditus, concerning whom he writes, "He was sick nigh unto death, but God had mercy on him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:147
verses.text: (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:148
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:149
verses.text: ) And many other instances there are of his ignorance of events, which was profitable both for him and his disciples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:150
verses.text: "Trophimus I have left at Miletum sick".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:151
verses.text: Miletus was near Ephesus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:152
