verses.text: Did this happen then when he sailed to Judea, or upon some other occasion? For after he had been in Rome, he returned to Spain, but whether he came thence again into these parts, we know not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:153
verses.text: We see him however deserted by all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:154
verses.text: "For Demas," he says, "hath forsaken me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:155
verses.text: Crescens is departed into Galatia, Titus to Dalmatia.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:156
verses.text: Erastus abode at Corinth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:157
verses.text: Trophimus have I left at Miletum sick".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:158
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:159
verses.text: "Do thy diligence to come before winter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:160
verses.text: Eubulus greeteth thee, and Pudens and Linus, and Claudia".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:161
verses.text: This Linus, some say, was second Bishop of the Church of Rome after Peter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:162
verses.text: "And Claudia".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:163
verses.text: You see how zealous for the faith the women were, how ardent! Such was Priscilla and this Claudia, already crucified, already prepared for the battle! But why, when there were so many faithful, does he mention only these women? Manifestly because they in purpose had already withdrawn from worldly affairs, and were illustrious above other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:164
verses.text: For a woman, as such, meets not with any impediments.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:165
verses.text: It is the work of divine grace, that this sex should be impeded only in the affairs of this life, or rather not even in them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:166
verses.text: For a woman undertakes no small share of the whole administration, being the keeper of the house.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:167
verses.text: And without her not even political affairs could be properly conducted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:168
verses.text: For if their domestic concerns were in a state of confusion and disorder, those who are engaged in public affairs would be kept at home, and political business would be ill managed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:169
verses.text: So that neither in those matters, as neither in spiritual, is she inferior.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:170
verses.text: For she is able, if so inclined, to endure a thousand deaths.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:171
verses.text: Accordingly many women have suffered martyrdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:172
verses.text: She is able to practice chastity even more than men, no such strong flame disturbing her; and to show forth modesty and gravity, and "holiness, without which no one shall see the Lord" (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:173
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:174
verses.text: ); and contempt of wealth, if she will, and in short all other virtues.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:175
verses.text: "Do thy diligence to come before winter".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:176
verses.text: See how he urges him, yet he does not say anything to grieve him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:177
verses.text: He does not say, "Before I die," lest he should afflict him; but, "Before winter," that thou be not detained.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:178
verses.text: "Eubulus," he says, "greeteth thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:179
verses.text: He does not mention the rest by name.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:180
verses.text: Seest thou that those were the most zealous?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:181
verses.text: "The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:182
verses.text: There can be no better prayer than this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:183
verses.text: Grieve not for my departure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:184
verses.text: The Lord will be with thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:185
verses.text: And he says, not "with thee," but "with thy spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:186
verses.text: Thus there is a twofold assistance, the grace of the Spirit, and God helping it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:187
verses.text: And otherwise God will not be with us, if we have not spiritual grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:188
verses.text: For if we be deserted by grace, how shall He be with us?  "Grace be with us, Amen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:189
verses.text: Thus he prays for himself too, that they may always be well-pleasing to Him, that they may have grace together with the spiritual gift, for where this is, nothing will be grievous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:190
verses.text: For as he who beholds the king, and is in favor with him, is sensible of no uneasiness; so though our friends forsake us, though we be overtaken by calamity, we shall feel no distress, if that grace be with us and fortify us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:191
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:192
verses.text: But how shall we draw down grace upon us? By doing what is pleasing to God, and obeying Him in all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:193
verses.text: In great houses do we not see those domestics in favor, who do not regard their own interest, but with all zeal and alacrity promote their masters', and who not from the compulsion of the master, but from their own affection and good disposition, order all things well.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:194
verses.text: When they are always before their eyes, when they are engaged in the house, when they are not occupied in any private concerns, nor caring for their own, but rather consider their masters' concerns as their own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:195
verses.text: For he who makes what is his own his master's, does not really give up his own to his master, but makes his interest his own; he commands even as himself in his affairs, and rules equally with him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:196
verses.text: He is often as much feared by the domestics, and whatever he says his master says too, and he is henceforth dreaded by all his enemies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:197
verses.text: And if he who in worldly concerns prefers his masters interests to his own, does not really neglect his own interest, but rather advance it the more; much more is this the case in spiritual matters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:198
verses.text: Despise thine own concerns, and thou wilt receive those of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:199
verses.text: This He Himself wills.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:200
verses.text: Despise each, and seize upon the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:201
verses.text: Dwell there, not here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:202
verses.text: Be formidable there, not here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:203
verses.text: If thou art formidable there thou wilt be formidable not to men, but to demons, and even to the devil himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:204
verses.text: But if thy dependence is on worldly wealth, thou wilt be contemptible to them, and often to men too.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:205
verses.text: Whatever be thy riches, thou wilt be rich in servile things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:206
verses.text: But if thou despisest these, thou wilt be radiant in the house of the King.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:207
verses.text: Such were the Apostles, despising a servile house and worldly wealth! And see how they commanded in the affairs of their Master.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:208
verses.text: "Let one," they said, "be delivered from disease, another from the possession of devils: bind this man, and loose that".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:209
verses.text: This was done by them on earth, but it was fulfilled as in Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:210
verses.text: For, "whatever ye shall bind on earth," said He, "shall be bound in Heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:211
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:212
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:213
verses.text: ) And greater power than His own did He give them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:214
verses.text: And that I lie not, appears from His own words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:215
verses.text: "He that believeth in Me, greater works shall he do than these which I do".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:216
verses.text: (John xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:217
verses.text: ) Why so? Because this honor is reflected upon the Master.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:218
verses.text: As in our own affairs, if the servant has great power, the master is the more admired, for if the servant is so powerful, much more is he who commands him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:219
verses.text: But if any man, neglecting his master's service thinks only of his wife, his son, or his servant, and seeks to be rich, and to lay up treasure there, by stealing and robbing his master of his possessions, he is presently ruined, and his wealth perishes with him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:220
verses.text: Wherefore having these examples, I beseech you, let us not regard our possessions, that we may regard ourselves: nay, let us despise them, that we may obtain them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:221
verses.text: If we despise them, He will take care of them; if we take care of them, God will despise them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:222
verses.text: Let us labor in the concerns of God, not in our own, or rather really in our own, for His are our own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:223
verses.text: I speak not of heaven, nor of earth, nor of the things of this world: these are unworthy of Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:224
verses.text: And they belong alike to the faithful and the unbelievers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:225
verses.text: What then do I speak of as His? His glory and His kingdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:226
verses.text: These are His, and ours for His sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:227
verses.text: How? "If we be dead with Him," He says, "we shall also live with Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:228
verses.text: If we suffer, we shall also reign with Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:229
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:230
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:231
verses.text: ) We are become "joint heirs," and are called His "brethren".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:232
verses.text: Why do we sink below, when He is drawing us upward towards Himself? How long shall we be poor, and beggarly? Heaven is set before us; and do we linger on earth? Is His kingdom opened to us, and do we choose such poverty as is here? Is life immortal offered us, and do we spend ourselves for lands, for wood and stones? Be truly rich.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:233
verses.text: I would wish thee to be so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:234
verses.text: Be covetous and rapacious, I blame thee not for it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:235
verses.text: Here it is a fault not to be covetous, here it is blameworthy not to be grasping.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:236
verses.text: What then is this? "The kingdom of Heaven suffereth violence, and the violent take it by force".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:237
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:238
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:239
verses.text: ) There be thou violent! be grasping! It is not diminished by being seized upon.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:240
verses.text: For neither is virtue divided, nor piety lessened, nor the kingdom of Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:241
verses.text: Virtue is increased when thou seizest upon it, whilst temporal goods are lessened when they are seized upon.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:242
verses.text: And this appears from hence: Let there be ten thousand men in a city; if all seize on virtue, it is multiplied, for they become righteous in ten thousand things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:243
verses.text: If no one seizes upon it, it is diminished, for it is nowhere to be found.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:244
verses.text: Thou seest then that good things are multiplied on being possessed by many, but earthly goods are rather diminished by seizing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:245
verses.text: Let us not therefore sit down content with poverty, but let us choose riches.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:246
verses.text: God is then rich, when those who enjoy His kingdom are many.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:247
verses.text: "For He is rich," it is said, "unto all that call upon Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:248
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:249
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:250
verses.text: ) Increase then His substance; and thou wilt increase it by taking possession of it, by being covetous of it, by violently seizing it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:251
verses.text: And truly there is need of violence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:252
verses.text: Wherefore? Because there are so many impediments, as wives and children, cares and worldly business; besides those demons, and him who is the ruler of them, the devil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:253
verses.text: There is need then of violence, there is need of fortitude.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:254
verses.text: He who takes by violence is exposed to toils.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:255
verses.text: How? He endures all things, he contends against necessities.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:256
verses.text: How? He almost attempts impossibilities.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:257
verses.text: If such are those who take by violence, and we shrink from attempting even what is possible, how shall we ever win? or when shall we enjoy the things for which we strive? "The violent," it is said, "take" the kingdom of heaven "by force".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:258
verses.text: Violence and rapacity are needed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:259
verses.text: For it is not simply set before us, and ready to our hands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:260
verses.text: He who seizes by violence, is ever sober and watchful, he is anxious and thoughtful, that he may make his seizure at a seasonable time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:261
verses.text: Dost thou not see that in war he who is about to make a seizure keeps watch and is under arms the whole night? If then they who aim at seizing upon worldly goods, watch and are armed all the night long, should we, who wish to seize upon spiritual things, sleep and snore in the day, and continue always naked and unarmed? For he who is engaged in sin is unarmed; as he who practices righteousness is armed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:262
verses.text: We do not fortify ourselves with almsgiving.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:263
verses.text: We do not prepare for ourselves lamps that are burning, we do not fence ourselves in spiritual armor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:264
verses.text: We do not learn the way that leads thither.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:265
verses.text: We are not sober and watchful, and therefore we can seize no spoil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:266
verses.text: If a man wishes to make an attempt on a kingdom, does he not set death before him in a thousand shapes? Is he not armed at all points, does he not practice the art of war, does he not do everything with this view, and so rush on to the attack? But we do not act thus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:267
verses.text: We wish to take the spoil while we are sleeping, and therefore we come off with empty hands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:268
verses.text: Dost thou not see plunderers, how they flee, how rapidly they move? how they force their way through everything? And there is need of expedition here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:269
verses.text: The devil is in pursuit of thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:270
verses.text: He orders those before to detain thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:271
verses.text: But if thou art strong, if thou art watchful, thou wilt spurn one, and thrust aside another, and escape from all, as a bird.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:272
verses.text: Yea, if thou depart hence, if thou escape from the market and the tumult, I mean this life, and arrive at those higher regions beyond these, in the world to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:273
verses.text: For there, as in a solitude, there is no tumult, no one to disturb, or to stay thy course.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:274
verses.text: Hast thou seized? Yet a little exertion is needed after the seizure, that what thou hast seized may not be taken from thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:275
verses.text: If we run on, if we look to none of those things that are set before our eyes, if we consider nothing but how we may escape from those who would hinder us, we shall be able to retain with all security what we have seized.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:276
verses.text: Hast thou seized on chastity? Tarry not; flee beyond the reach of the devil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:277
verses.text: If he sees that he cannot overtake thee, he will cease to pursue; as we, when we can no longer see those who have robbed us, despair of the pursuit, and do not pursue, nor call on others to stop thief, but suffer them to escape.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:278
verses.text: So do thou run vigorously at the beginning, and when thou art beyond the reach of the devil, he will not afterwards attack thee, but thou wilt be in safety, securely enjoying those unspeakable blessings, which God grant that we may all obtain through Jesus Christ our Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Timothy 10:279
verses.text: To whom with the Father, and the Holy Ghost, be glory, power, honor, and worship, now and for ever, and world without end, Amen.
